commit_message:
tempest cli work in progress

This branch is to be used as a whiteboard
for tempest cli design, see spec review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/138785/

Note: introduction of cli_tools library is causing
tests to fail as it is not in 
global-requirements.txt.  Please ignore as this patch
is merely a shared prototype

Change-Id: I25b35307c3bbd8ae379be9bcf85b476492011fb5

commit_message:
Test script for CRUD operations on trove instances

Adds a directory instances with test script 'test_instances.py'
to database api tests.
Adds related JSON supporting methods in client file
'instance_client.py' present in 'tempest/services/database/json'.
Adds api_schema for database instances in 'tempest/api_schema'
directory.
Addition of api_schema includes creation of a folder for database
with two files 'instances.py' and 'parameter_types.py'.
Modified 'tempest.conf.sample' and 'config.py' to add parameters
build_interval and build_timeout.
Modified 'base.py' of api database tests and clients.py to add the
details of instance_client.py.
Adds a method 'wait_for_db_instance_status' to waiters.py present
in 'tempest/common' so as to implement logic to wait till db
instance reaches the desired status.
Adds a class 'DbInstanceBuildErrorException' to exceptions.py present
in 'tempest/' to raise an exception message when database instance
reaches ERROR state.
Also corrected minor pep8 validations in "wait_for_server_status"
method of waiters.py script and "__str__" method of class
"CommandFailed" in exceptions.py

Change-Id: I06bb26e299c6c73e014574c8ea6b6857f356c66f

commit_message:
baremetal: skip test_network_basic_ops

Baremetal (Ironic) does not have floating IPs. So skip the test
TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops

Closes-Bug: #1513337
Change-Id: I3e0b981848d29ad2e9855c27c3c307a3e7a40fc3

commit_message:
Update Security Group negative test case to BadRequest

The value 'bad_group_id' is not a UUID, and Neutron's API has been
changed to return a BadRequest error when you do not send a UUID in your
request to the Security Group API.

Change-Id: I820cbd99b58a6f286f156550903abd070fc9e37b
Depends-On: I95c570d4d8b1b0b30f2ded64f11716ca9d5f8a3b

commit_message:
Add a simple test for Allowed Address Pairs

* This test will check for connectivity to VMs given various
  source IPs. Only the source IPs configured by the allowed
  address pairs extension should be allowed (in addition to
  the fixed IP assigned to the VM).
* Steps in the test:
  SIP1 = fixed IP of VM1.
  SIP2 = additional IP, not associated with VM1.
  DIP = fixed IP of VM2.
  1) Create 2 servers on the same subnet.
  2) Add SIP2 to VM1, but NOT to the ports fixed IPs.
  3) verify ping SIP1 -> DIP SUCCEEDS.
     verify ping SIP2 -> DIP FAILS.
  4) Add SIP2 to the allowed address pairs.
  5) verify ping SIP1 -> DIP SUCCEEDS.
     verify ping SIP2 -> DIP SUCCEEDS.
  6) remove SIP2 from the allowed address pairs.
  7) verify ping SIP1 -> DIP SUCCEEDS.
     verify ping SIP2 -> DIP FAILS.

Change-Id: I267a5e335852d5fa1c93cf119a9dad1d645c458c

added_lines: def _get_server_mac(self, server): """ return the mac address of the server """ network_name = self.tenants[server['tenant_id']].network.name return server['addresses'][network_name][0]['OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr'] def _get_ssh_connection(self, tenant, server_port_id): """ get a RemoteClient to a given server identified by the port id """ fip_addr = self.floating_ips[server_port_id].floating_ip_address private_key = tenant.keypair['private_key'] ssh_access = self._ssh_to_server(fip_addr, private_key=private_key) return ssh_access def _check_connectivity(self, access_point, ip, source_addr=None, should_succeed=True): source_addr, @test.requires_ext(service='network', extension='allowed-address-pairs') @test.idempotent_id('382466d8-6725-11e5-806f-3c970eb1df4d') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_allowed_address_pairs(self): """ Simple test to verify that connections can be made according to the configured allowed address pairs """ new_tenant = self.primary_tenant # Allow Ping and ssh everywhere. we use ping to verify connectivity, # and we use ssh to connect to a VM and add addresses. icmp = dict(protocol='icmp', direction='ingress') ssh_in = dict(protocol='tcp', port_range_min=22, port_range_max=22, direction='ingress') ssh_eg = dict(protocol='tcp', port_range_min=22, port_range_max=22, direction='egress') def add_rule(rule): self._create_security_group_rule( secgroup=new_tenant.security_groups['default'], **rule ) add_rule(icmp) add_rule(ssh_in) add_rule(ssh_eg) # Create server source. This is the VM where the pings will originate. # Why not just use the access point? because we will be adding # addresses to this VM's eth0. src_name = 'server-{tenant}-source'.format( tenant=new_tenant.creds.tenant_name ) src_name = data_utils.rand_name(src_name) source = self._create_server(src_name, new_tenant) src_server_id = source['id'] src_port_id = self._list_ports(device_id=src_server_id)[0]['id'] self._assign_floating_ips(new_tenant, source) source_ssh = self._get_ssh_connection(new_tenant, src_server_id) # Create server destination. dest_name = 'server-{tenant}-destination'.format( tenant=new_tenant.creds.tenant_name ) dest_name = data_utils.rand_name(dest_name) destination = self._create_server(dest_name, new_tenant) def get_incr_ip(ip): """ Get the next IP. """ addr = ip.split('.') end = str(int(addr[3]) + 1) return addr[0] + '.' + addr[1] + '.' + addr[2] + '.' + end dest_addr = self._get_server_ip(destination) first_addr = self._get_server_ip(source) second_addr = get_incr_ip(dest_addr) mac = self._get_server_mac(source) try: addr_pairs = [{'ip_address': second_addr, 'mac_address': mac}] self._add_address(source_ssh, second_addr) # Only the assigned IP should work. self._check_connectivity(source_ssh, dest_addr, source_addr=second_addr, should_succeed=False) self._check_connectivity(source_ssh, dest_addr, source_addr=first_addr, should_succeed=True) self.network_client.update_port(src_port_id, allowed_address_pairs=addr_pairs) # Now both IPs should work. self._check_connectivity(source_ssh, dest_addr, source_addr=first_addr, should_succeed=True) self._check_connectivity(source_ssh, dest_addr, source_addr=second_addr, should_succeed=True) self.network_client.update_port(src_port_id, allowed_address_pairs=[]) # Now only the assigned IP should work. self._check_connectivity(source_ssh, dest_addr, source_addr=first_addr, should_succeed=True) self._check_connectivity(source_ssh, dest_addr, source_addr=second_addr, should_succeed=False) except Exception: for tenant in self.tenants.values(): self._log_console_output(servers=tenant.servers) raise

commit_message:
Adds Create/Get/List Samples tests to telemetry

This submission adds a test case
"test_create_get_and_list_samples" for create, get and list
operations on Samples.

Added "show_sample", modified "add_sample" and
"create_sample" methods in
"tempest/services/telemetry/json/telemetry_client.py".

Also added "wait_for_samples" method under
"tempest/api/telemetry/base.py".

Change-Id: I2ccd97d37350df284dc8771498d2a9f0cc80b94e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/210324/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
remove default=None for config options

In the cfg module default=None is set as the default value. It's not
necessary to set it again when defining config options.

Change-Id: I6a0fcb4045431b9ce40eee074fb9a2bbedc5241c
Closes-bug: #1323975

commit_message:
Add test URL of VNC and SPICE consoles

Nova can be configured to provide access into instance via SPICE or
noVNC console. If is this option enabled, you will get URL of particular
console.

Change-Id: Ia2c7fe14c7714415ced9b4ec2cfc3be80b23ab52

commit_message:
Add aggregate look up in test_live_migrations

The test_live_migration test assumes that all the compute hosts are
in the same pool. If a user has an environment where their hosts are in
different aggregates, there is a very good chance that the target host
to migrate to may not be of the same aggregate.

In that scenario, the instance may be migrated to an incompatible host,
and the test will fail for the wrong reason.

def _get_compute_hostnames was changed to first look for the current
host in all available aggregates. It returns the first aggregate host
list that has itself in it and at least one other host. To make the
method more descriptive, it was renamed to
_get_compute_hosts_in_same_aggregate.

If that search turns up empty, the method falls through to the default
lookup behavior.

Change-Id: Iffb442bfcbe0b8f7cb891322676b98bfad2e53f9

commit_message:
Test script for CRUD operations on Consumers

This submission adds new test script test_consumers.py
to verify Consumer API of Keystone.

Required supporting functions are added in new client
file "consumers_client.py" under JSON interface.

Modified base.py and clients.py files.

Change-Id: Ibe23769475adc6f730590897f08a9a70f0f43974

commit_message:
Verify the capabilities of the domain administrator

According to documentation (http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/identity-domains.html),
user with admin role assigned must be as powerful
as root admin within assigned domain.

Change-Id: I81caffdd997f25ee08f052ba922a27378cf2bf24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/15/159915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: admin_manager = clients.Manager(credentials=creds) token, auth_data = admin_manager.auth_provider.get_auth() admin_client = admin_manager.identity_v3_client result = admin_client.get_token(token) # verify abilities of the new domain administrator - first, create # new project in the domain proj_name = data_utils.rand_name('proj') proj_body = admin_client.create_project(proj_name, domain_id=dom_id) proj_id = proj_body['id'] self.addCleanup(admin_client.delete_project, proj_id) self.assertEqual(proj_body['domain_id'], dom_id, "project " + proj_name + "doesn't have domain id " + dom_id) # create new group in the domain name = data_utils.rand_name('Group') description = data_utils.rand_name('Description') group = admin_client.create_group(name, description=description, domain_id=dom_id, project_id=proj_id) self.addCleanup(admin_client.delete_group, group['id']) self.assertEqual(group['name'], name) self.assertEqual(group['description'], description) # create a user in the domain, with the previous project as his # default project user_name = data_utils.rand_name('user') user_body = admin_client.create_user(user_name, password=user_name, domain_id=dom_id, default_project_id=proj_id) user_id = user_body['id'] self.addCleanup(admin_client.delete_user, user_id) self.assertEqual(user_body['domain_id'], dom_id, "user " + user_name + "doesn't have domain id " + dom_id) # add user to group admin_client.add_group_user(group['id'], user_id)

commit_message:
Adds LIST meters test to telemetry

This submission adds a test case "test_list_meters"
for list operations on Meters under new test script
"tempest/api/telemetry/admin/admin/test_telemetry_meters_api.py".

Change-Id: Ibfa4d29a738ca36cc7e2c639769832154f2fc43c

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.telemetry import base from tempest import test class TelemetryMetersAPITestJSON(base.BaseTelemetryAdminTest): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(TelemetryMetersAPITestJSON, cls).setup_clients() cls.client = cls.telemetry_admin_client @test.idempotent_id('ee99a375-8786-458e-82cf-45bd961b46af') def test_list_meters(self): # Verify List meters expected_keys = ['user_id', 'name', 'resource_id', 'source', 'meter_id', 'project_id', 'type', 'unit'] meters = self.client.list_meters() self.assertNotEmpty(meters, "No meters found.") actual_keys = meters[0].keys() for m_key in expected_keys: self.assertIn(m_key, actual_keys)

commit_message:
Adds scenario tests for block device mappings.

This patch adds the test cases for booting with different combinations
of block device mappings.

Change-Id: Iede55554a4120c49e194ebc452e5ad350a3137ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/223718/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# Copyright (c) 2015 Cloudbase Solutions SRL # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log from tempest import config from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest_lib import exceptions CONF = config.CONF LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class TestBDMBoot(manager.ScenarioTest): def setUp(self): super(TestBDMBoot, self).setUp() self.image_ref = CONF.compute.image_ref self.keypair = self.create_keypair() self.security_group = self._create_security_group() def flavor_clean_up(self, flavor_id): self.flavors_client.delete_flavor(flavor_id) self.flavors_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(flavor_id) def create_flavor(self, size_ephemeral): flavor_name_prefix = 'test_flavor_' ram = 128 vcpus = 1 disk = 5 flavor_name = data_utils.rand_name(flavor_name_prefix) flavor = self.flavors_client.create_flavor( name=flavor_name, ram=ram, vcpus=vcpus, disk=disk, ephemeral=size_ephemeral)['flavor'] self.addCleanup(self.flavor_clean_up, flavor['id']) return flavor['id'] def _create_volume_empty_or_from_image(self, imageRef=None, size=None): vol_name = 'volume_name' if imageRef: vol = self.create_volume(name=vol_name, size=size, imageRef=self.image_ref) else: vol = self.create_volume(name=vol_name, size=size) return vol def add_floating_ip(self, instance): return self.create_floating_ip(thing=instance)['ip'] def get_ssh(self, ip): return self.get_remote_client(server_or_ip=ip, username=CONF.compute.image_ssh_user) def run_cmd(self, ssh_client, cmd): return ssh_client.exec_command(cmd) def add_to_bd_map_v2(self, curr_bd_map_v2, src_type, dest_type, **kwargs): bd_map_v2_to_be_added = [{ 'source_type': src_type, 'destination_type': dest_type, }] optional_args = ['boot_index', 'disk_bus', 'uuid', 'volume_size', 'format_type', 'delete_on_termination'] for arg in optional_args: if arg in kwargs: bd_map_v2_to_be_added[0][arg] = kwargs[arg] curr_bd_map_v2 += bd_map_v2_to_be_added return curr_bd_map_v2 def _boot_instance_with_bd_map_v2(self, bd_map_v2, image_ref='', flavor_has_ephemeral=True): if flavor_has_ephemeral: # flavor with ephemeral flavor_ref = self.create_flavor(size_ephemeral=5) else: # flavor without ephemeral flavor_ref = self.create_flavor(size_ephemeral=0) if image_ref != '': bd_map_v2 += [{ 'uuid': image_ref, 'source_type': 'image', 'destination_type': 'local', 'delete_on_termination': True, 'boot_index': 0, }] create_kwargs = { 'block_device_mapping_v2': bd_map_v2, 'key_name': self.keypair['name'], 'security_groups': [{'name': self.security_group['name']}] } return self.create_server(image=image_ref, flavor=flavor_ref, create_kwargs=create_kwargs) def _get_disk_mount_point_by_size(self, ssh_client, disk_size): cmd = ("sudo fdisk -l 2>/dev/null | grep 'Disk /' | " "awk '{print substr($2, 6, 4) substr($3, 1, 1)}' | " "grep %(disk_size)s | cut -c1-3 | tr -d '
'" % {'disk_size': disk_size}) try: disk_mount_point = self.run_cmd(ssh_client, cmd) return disk_mount_point except exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: return None # disk not found def _get_disk_type(self, ssh_client, disk_mount_point): # NOTE(abalutoiu): In both cases (SCSI and IDE), disks will be attached # as SCSI devices, but the SCSI disk will have QEMU type while the # IDE disk will have ATA type try: cmd = ('sudo dmesg | grep "\[%(disk_mount_point)s] Attached SCSI"' " | awk '{print $4}' | tr -d '
'" % {'disk_mount_point': disk_mount_point}) disk_info_code = self.run_cmd(ssh_client, cmd) cmd = ("sudo dmesg | grep 'scsi %(disk_info_code)s'" " | awk '{print $6}' | tr -d '
'" % {'disk_info_code': disk_info_code}) return self.run_cmd(ssh_client, cmd) except exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: return None def check_disk_type(self, ssh_client, disk_size, disk_type): disk_mount_point = self._get_disk_mount_point_by_size(ssh_client, disk_size) if disk_mount_point is None: return False if disk_type == "scsi": disk_expected_type = "QEMU" elif disk_type == "ide": disk_expected_type = "ATA" else: raise Exception("Unsupported disk type.") if disk_expected_type == self._get_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_mount_point): return True return False def check_order_disks(self, ssh_client, disk_size_list=[]): previous_mount_point = self._get_disk_mount_point_by_size( ssh_client, disk_size_list[0]) for disk_size in disk_size_list[1:]: curr_mount_point = self._get_disk_mount_point_by_size(ssh_client, disk_size) if previous_mount_point[-1] > curr_mount_point[-1]: return False return True def test_boot_from_volume(self): vol_size_bootable = 1 bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=[], src_type='image', dest_type='volume', uuid=self.image_ref, boot_index=0, disk_bus='scsi', volume_size=vol_size_bootable, delete_on_termination=True) instance = self._boot_instance_with_bd_map_v2(bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list) fl_ip = self.add_floating_ip(instance=instance) ssh_client = self.get_ssh(ip=fl_ip) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_bootable, disk_type='scsi')) def test_boot_from_volume_with_ephemeral(self): vol_size_bootable = 1 vol_size_ephemeral = 2 bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=[], src_type='image', dest_type='volume', uuid=self.image_ref, boot_index=0, disk_bus='ide', volume_size=vol_size_bootable, delete_on_termination=True) bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list, src_type='blank', dest_type='local', boot_index=1, disk_bus='ide', volume_size=vol_size_ephemeral) instance = self._boot_instance_with_bd_map_v2(bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list) fl_ip = self.add_floating_ip(instance=instance) ssh_client = self.get_ssh(ip=fl_ip) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_bootable, disk_type='ide')) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_ephemeral, disk_type='ide')) # check disk attach order by using their size self.assertTrue(self.check_order_disks( ssh_client, disk_size_list=[vol_size_bootable, vol_size_ephemeral])) def test_boot_flavor_without_ephemeral(self): vol_size_ephemeral = 1 vol_size_bootable = 1 bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=[], src_type='image', dest_type='volume', uuid=self.image_ref, boot_index=0, disk_bus='scsi', volume_size=vol_size_bootable, delete_on_termination=True) bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list, src_type='blank', dest_type='local', boot_index=1, disk_bus='ide', volume_size=vol_size_ephemeral) self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self._boot_instance_with_bd_map_v2, bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list, flavor_has_ephemeral=False) def test_boot_multiple_volumes_attached(self): vol_size_bootable = 1 vol_size_ephemeral = 2 vol_size_scsi = 3 bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=[], src_type='image', dest_type='volume', uuid=self.image_ref, boot_index=0, disk_bus='scsi', volume_size=vol_size_bootable, delete_on_termination=True) bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list, src_type='blank', dest_type='local', boot_index=1, disk_bus='scsi', volume_size=vol_size_ephemeral) volume = self._create_volume_empty_or_from_image(size=vol_size_scsi) bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list, src_type='volume', dest_type='volume', uuid=volume['id'], boot_index=2, disk_bus='ide', delete_on_termination=True) instance = self._boot_instance_with_bd_map_v2(bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list) fl_ip = self.add_floating_ip(instance=instance) ssh_client = self.get_ssh(ip=fl_ip) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_bootable, disk_type='scsi')) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_ephemeral, disk_type='scsi')) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_scsi, disk_type='ide')) # check disk attach order by using their size self.assertTrue(self.check_order_disks( ssh_client, disk_size_list=[vol_size_bootable, vol_size_ephemeral, vol_size_scsi])) def _test_boot_multiple_ephemerals_attached(self, first_disk_type, second_disk_type): vol_size_eph_1 = 1 vol_size_eph_2 = 2 bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=[], src_type='blank', dest_type='local', boot_index=1, disk_bus=first_disk_type, volume_size=vol_size_eph_1) bd_map_v2_list = self.add_to_bd_map_v2(curr_bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list, src_type='blank', dest_type='local', boot_index=2, disk_bus=second_disk_type, volume_size=vol_size_eph_2) instance = self._boot_instance_with_bd_map_v2( image_ref=self.image_ref, bd_map_v2=bd_map_v2_list) fl_ip = self.add_floating_ip(instance=instance) ssh_client = self.get_ssh(ip=fl_ip) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_eph_1, disk_type=first_disk_type)) self.assertTrue(self.check_disk_type(ssh_client, disk_size=vol_size_eph_2, disk_type=second_disk_type)) # check disk attach order by using their size self.assertTrue(self.check_order_disks( ssh_client, disk_size_list=[vol_size_eph_1, vol_size_eph_2])) def test_boot_two_ide_ephemerals(self): self._test_boot_multiple_ephemerals_attached( first_disk_type='ide', second_disk_type='ide') def test_boot_two_mixt_ephemerals(self): self._test_boot_multiple_ephemerals_attached( first_disk_type='scsi', second_disk_type='ide')

commit_message:
Check FloatingIP status before connecting to access-points

We have recently seen some failures in this area with the
DVR routers where the connection to the floatingIP is timing
out. We need to verify if the floatingIP is an active state
before pinging the VM. The reason is with the addition of
DVR routers, the time taken for the floatingIP status to be
active is little longer than the traditional legacy routers.

This patch checks for the FloatingIP status before it tries
to connect to the access-points for all its tests.

Change-Id: If6bef68d8a3c6976268f9e6c80d4690180e3605a

commit_message:
test_verify_server_details fails due to extra info in meta data

In order to make this test case apply to both openstack native scheduler
and third party nova scheduler plug-in, we should enhance it to use
"assertDictContainsSubset" rather than assertEqual, so that extra info
in meta data can pass the test case

Change-Id: Ida88e97b84d2ec1a40751a04db674d8fc2132790
Closes-Bug: #1453668

commit_message:
Add basic 'extraroute' test

This patch adds a basic test for the 'extraroute' neutron extension.
The steps for the test are:

 1) Create a server to receive pings.
    SIP = the original server IP.
    DIP1 = new IP not on original IP subnet.
    DIP2 = additional IP not on original IP subnet.
 2) verify pings to:
    SIP - succeeds
    DIP1 - fails
    DIP2 - fails
 3) add extra routes for DIP1 and DIP2
 4) verify pings to:
    SIP - succeeds
    DIP1 - succeeds
    DIP2 - succeeds
 5) remove extra route for DIP2
 6) verify pings to:
    SIP - succeeds
    DIP1 - succeeds
    DIP2 - fails
 7) remove extra route for DIP1, re-add route for DIP2
 8) verify pings to:
    SIP - succeeds
    DIP1 - fails
    DIP2 - succeeds
 9) remove extra route for DIP2
 10) verify pings to:
    SIP - succeeds
    DIP1 - fails
    DIP2 - fails

Change-Id: I72dcc9af06772f9870d83ae929588b1d48ca5e49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/34/234534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.requires_ext(service='network', extension='extraroute') @test.idempotent_id('66a33f7a-7161-11e5-8f0d-3c970eb1df4d') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_extra_routes(self): """ 1) Create a server to receive pings. SIP = the original server IP. DIP1 = new IP not on original IP subnet. DIP2 = additional IP not on original IP subnet. 2) verify pings to: SIP - succeeds DIP1 - fails DIP2 - fails 3) add extra routes for DIP1 and DIP2 4) verify pings to: SIP - succeeds DIP1 - succeeds DIP2 - succeeds 5) remove extra route for DIP2 6) verify pings to: SIP - succeeds DIP1 - succeeds DIP2 - fails 7) remove extra route for DIP1, re-add route for DIP2 8) verify pings to: SIP - succeeds DIP1 - fails DIP2 - succeeds 9) remove extra route for DIP2 10) verify pings to: SIP - succeeds DIP1 - fails DIP2 - fails """ self._setup_network_and_servers() # Create destination server to receive pings name = data_utils.rand_name('server-extra-routes') destination = self._create_server(name, self.network) dest_floating_ip = self.create_floating_ip(destination) private_key = self._get_server_key(destination) ssh_client = self._ssh_to_server(dest_floating_ip.floating_ip_address, private_key) # Destination IPs to test connectivity DIP1 = '3.3.3.3' DIP2 = '4.4.4.4' # Add the IPs to the destination server so that it will respond to # pings self._add_address(ssh_client, DIP1) self._add_address(ssh_client, DIP2) floating_ip, server = self.floating_ip_tuple server_ip = destination['addresses'][self.network['name']][0]['addr'] # Without extra routes, only the IP on the same subnet should respond self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [server_ip], should_connect=True) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [DIP1, DIP2], should_connect=False) # All IPs should be reachable given the extra routes routes = [{'destination': '3.3.3.0/24', 'nexthop': server_ip}, {'destination': '4.4.4.0/24', 'nexthop': server_ip}] self.network_client.update_router(self.router['id'], routes=routes) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [server_ip, DIP1, DIP2], should_connect=True) # Test that only one extra IP has connectivity routes = [{'destination': '3.3.3.0/24', 'nexthop': server_ip}] self.network_client.update_router(self.router['id'], routes=routes) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [server_ip, DIP1], should_connect=True) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [DIP2], should_connect=False) # Test that the other IP has connectivity routes = [{'destination': '4.4.4.0/24', 'nexthop': server_ip}] self.network_client.update_router(self.router['id'], routes=routes) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [server_ip, DIP2], should_connect=True) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [DIP1], should_connect=False) # Back to the original state self.network_client.update_router(self.router['id'], routes=[]) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [server_ip], should_connect=True) self._check_server_connectivity(floating_ip, [DIP1, DIP2], should_connect=False)

commit_message:
Adds Database Instance/Actions/Users API Tests

* Create database instance
* Get database instance
* List database instance
* Delete database instance
* Enable root access to database instance
* Restart database instance
* Resize database instance
* Resize volume of database instance

* Create/delete database for given db instance
* List databases for given db instance

* Create/delete database users
* List database users

Partially implements blueprint: tempest-guest-tests

Change-Id: If3d9004558d0ec9bb2b15dbfa1fb2bc419a51abe

commit_message:
WIP: use local addCleanup to avoid quota issues

To be robust, all the calls in the class need addCleanup with this approach.

This fails on the delete with

Details: {u'message': u'Unable to complete operation on subnet 6cdc94d4-1889-4df0-9966-550f4fe79ca9. One or more ports have an IP allocation from this subnet.', u'type': u'SubnetInUse', u'detail': u''}

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Treinish <mtreinish@kortar.org>
Change-Id: I81188888e9eac764f40c9e99e1d0ff0b50ed5ba7

commit_message:
Add volume snapshot list pagination tests

New functionality is being added in Cinder to allow pagination in
snapshot list. This patch provides tempest tests to check that
functionality.

New configuration option is added called list_pagination that allows
selecting if we want this functionality tested (since it won't be
available in all Cinder V2 API deployments).

Reason why that configuration option is a list is because later on we'll
be adding backup list pagination as well, so this way we can define
which list paginations we want to check with the same option.

Blueprint snapshots-and-bakcup-support-pagination-query
Depends-On: I21edac6d29abf7fc2f446111a7d6888db9ab6eba
Change-Id: Ie854ff58540a8e7d88d41a2c4074ca49b8fe67df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/72/195072/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.ListOpt('list_pagination', default=[], help="List of resources for which to check v2 list pagination." " Currently only 1 value is acceptable, 'snapshots'. " "Example: available list_pagination = ['snapshots']"),

commit_message:
Adds 'list-cells' and 'cell-capacities' tests

This submission adds a new test "test_cells.py" under
"tempest/api/compute/admin" to verify list-cells and
cell-capacities functionality.

Modified clients.py file.

Also added supporting functions and api_schema under
"tempest/services/compute/json/cells_client" and
'tempest/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/cells.py" files.

Change-Id: Ib78fe8b960dc96a46daa5e460d79a799deeca254

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.volume import base from tempest import test class VolumesV2ListTest(base.BaseVolumeAdminTest): @test.idempotent_id('45945237-a865-4808-b284-7fbdd31a53d9') def test_list_volumes_with_all_tenants_filter(self): # Admin can list volumes of all tenants # Create volume for a non-admin tenant volume = self.volumes_client.create_volume() self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume['id'], 'available') self.addCleanup(self.volumes_client.delete_volume, volume['id']) # Create volume for admin tenant admin_volume = self.admin_volume_client.create_volume() self.admin_volume_client.wait_for_volume_status(admin_volume['id'], 'available') self.addCleanup(self.admin_volume_client.delete_volume, admin_volume['id']) # Fetch all volumes based on 'all_tenants' search filter param = {'all_tenants': 'true'} fetched_vol_list = self.admin_volume_client.list_volumes(params=param) vol_list = map(lambda vol: vol['id'], fetched_vol_list) # Now check if all created volumes are present in fetched list self.assertIn(admin_volume['id'], vol_list) self.assertIn(volume['id'], vol_list) # Fetch all volumes for non-admin user with 'all_tenants' # search filter fetched_vol_list = self.volumes_client.list_volumes(params=param) vol_list = map(lambda vol: vol['id'], fetched_vol_list) # Now check if all created volumes by admin are not present # in fetched list self.assertNotIn(admin_volume['id'], vol_list) self.assertIn(volume['id'], vol_list)

commit_message:
test_instance_access_secg_rule_with_remote_ip_pref

ix_any
This test verifies the instance access associated
security group rule refers remote_ip_prefix to
any ip just by refering 0.0.0.0/0

Change-Id: I4fbf1fac3a691f66f3a3f3badfbeeca088136545
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/158624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 12. _test_instance_access_secg_rule_with_remote_ip_prefix_any: test instance access with security group rule contains remote_ip_prefix refers any(i.e. 0.0.0.0/0) @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_instance_access_secg_rule_with_remote_ip_prefix_any(self): """ This test verifies associated security group rule to the instance contains remote-ip-prefix as any ip with direction """ cidr = '0.0.0.0/0' tenant_4 = self.primary_tenant ip = self._get_server_ip(tenant_4.access_point, floating=self.floating_ip_access) server_id = tenant_4.access_point['id'] port_id = self._list_ports(device_id=server_id)[0]['id'] ssh_login = CONF.compute.image_ssh_user private_key = tenant_4.keypair['private_key'] # checking instance access with default egress rule self.check_vm_connectivity(ip, should_connect=False) ruleset = dict( direction='ingress', remote_ip_prefix=cidr ) # adding remote_ip_prefix defined ingress rule self._create_security_group_rule( secgroup=tenant_4.security_groups['default'], **ruleset) # updating instance port with default rule contains remote_ip self.network_client.update_port(port_id, security_groups=[ tenant_4.security_groups['default'].id]) # checking instance access with ingress rule remote_ip_prefix any self.check_vm_connectivity(ip, username=ssh_login, private_key=private_key, should_connect=True)

test_instance_access_associated_rule_refers_protoc

 ol_number
This test verifies instance access upon adding
security group rule which refers protocol number.

Change-Id: Id8f861090be05067202d0b8b6bd4c2bfee75682e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/23/158223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 10._test_instance_access_associated_rule_refers_protocol_number: test instance access associated security group rule refers protocol number. @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_instance_access_associated_rule_refers_protocol_number(self): """ This test verifies associated security group rule to the instance contains protocol number on ingress direction """ tenant_2 = self.primary_tenant ip = self._get_server_ip(tenant_2.access_point, floating=self.floating_ip_access) server_id = tenant_2.access_point['id'] port_id = self._list_ports(device_id=server_id)[0]['id'] ssh_login = CONF.compute.image_ssh_user private_key = tenant_2.keypair['private_key'] self.check_vm_connectivity(ip, should_connect=False) rule_icmp = dict( protocol='1', direction='ingress' ) rule_tcp = dict( protocol='6', direction='ingress' ) self._create_security_group_rule( secgroup=tenant_2.security_groups['default'], **rule_icmp ) self._create_security_group_rule( secgroup=tenant_2.security_groups['default'], **rule_tcp ) """ update instance port with default security group which contains security group rule refers protocol number """ self.network_client.update_port(port_id, security_groups=[ tenant_2.security_groups['default'].id]) """ now instance associated the security group rule which refers respective protocol number (i.e. ICMP=1,TCP=6) The check_vm_connectivity tests -that vm ping test is successful -ssh to vm is successful """ self.check_vm_connectivity(ip, username=ssh_login, private_key=private_key, should_connect=True)

added_lines: 9._test_instance_access_with_ingress_rule: * test that traffic is blocked with empty security group * test that traffic is enabled after adding ingress rule to security group @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_instance_access_with_ingress_rule(self): """ This test verifies the instances access from ingress with and without ingress direction rule. """ tenant_1 = self.primary_tenant # Create empty security group empty_sg = self._create_empty_security_group( namestart='secgroup_ingress-', tenant_id=tenant_1.creds.tenant_id, client=tenant_1.manager.network_client) # Create server with empty security group name = 'server-{tenant}-ingress-'.format( tenant=tenant_1.creds.tenant_name ) name = data_utils.rand_name(name) secg = [] secg.append(empty_sg) server = self._create_server(name, tenant_1, security_groups=secg) # Check connectivity failure with empty security group try: access_point_ssh = self._connect_to_access_point(tenant_1) self._check_connectivity(access_point=access_point_ssh, ip=self._get_server_ip(server), should_succeed=False) # update security group with new ingress rule to security group ingress_rule = dict( direction='ingress', ) self._create_security_group_rule( secgroup=empty_sg, client=tenant_1.manager.network_client, **ingress_rule) # check connectivity after ingress rule adding self._check_connectivity( access_point=access_point_ssh, ip=self._get_server_ip(server)) except Exception: for tenant in self.tenants.values(): self._log_console_output(servers=tenant.servers) raise

commit_message:
Functional test for boot from volume

We need a test to catch the regression for
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1481164

At the moment the only test for boot from volume
is scenario.test_volume_boot_pattern,
which is aimed at general checks for data persistence.

This test should check that device_name inside guest matches
the reported by openstack.

Change-Id: Ic9c6e14700c3d8eee2069d8359b8393610a69a53
Depends-On: I6f8174af3dd86208de244f4862c83f090e42e9e6

added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('453070c8-606e-11e5-8e9f-fa163ec274e6') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.validation.run_validation, 'SSH required for this test') def test_boot_from_volume(self): image_ref_id = CONF.compute.image_ref bd_map_v2 = [{ 'device_name': self.device, 'uuid': image_ref_id, 'source_type': 'image', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'volume_size': CONF.volume.volume_size, 'boot_index': 0, 'delete_on_termination': True}] kwargs = {'image_id': '', 'block_device_mapping_v2': bd_map_v2} admin_pass = self.image_ssh_password self.server = self.create_test_server( validatable=True, wait_until='ACTIVE', adminPass=admin_pass, **kwargs) # Record addresses so that we can ssh later self.server['addresses'] = self.servers_client.list_addresses( self.server['id'])['addresses'] linux_client = remote_client.RemoteClient( self.get_server_ip(self.server), self.image_ssh_user, self.server['adminPass'], self.validation_resources['keypair']['private_key']) partitions = linux_client.get_partitions() self.assertIn(self.device, partitions)

commit_message:
Scenario - boot instances from multi backend

Test steps:
    * admin creates a volume type for each backend
    * create a volume from image for each backend
    * boot an instance from each volume
    * create a volume for each backend and attach it to instance.
    * attach volumes to instances
    * detach volumes from instances

Change-Id: Ife53d985d9ac98e88ca24783bfb3d35ca8f154d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/37/133937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import config from tempest.openstack.common import log from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class TestMultiBackendVolumesBoot(manager.ScenarioTest): """ This test case tests multi backend volumes. Test steps: * admin creates a volume type for each backend * create a volume from image for each backend * boot an instance from each volume * create a volume for each backend in order to attach it to instance. * attach volumes to instances * detach volumes from instances """ @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(TestMultiBackendVolumesBoot, cls).resource_setup() if not CONF.volume_feature_enabled.multi_backend: raise cls.skipException("Cinder multi-backend feature disabled") def _create_volume_type(self, backend_name_key): # create a volume type by volume admin extra_specs = {"volume_backend_name": backend_name_key} self.admin_manager.volume_types_client.create_volume_type( backend_name_key, extra_specs=extra_specs) def _create_volume_image_by_backend_name(self, size, backend_name_key): # create a volume from an image image_uuid = CONF.compute.image_ref volume_name = data_utils.rand_name('volume' + backend_name_key) volume = self.create_volume(size, name=volume_name, volume_type=backend_name_key, imageRef=image_uuid) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume['id'], 'available') return volume def _create_volume_snapshot(self, vol_id): snap_name = data_utils.rand_name('snapshot-') _, snap = self.snapshots_client.create_snapshot( volume_id=vol_id, display_name=snap_name) self.snapshots_client.wait_for_snapshot_status(snap['id'], 'available') self.assertEqual(snap_name, snap['display_name']) return snap def _boot_instance_from_volume(self, vol_id): bd_map = [{ 'device_name': 'vda', 'volume_id': vol_id, 'delete_on_termination': '0'}] create_kwargs = {'block_device_mapping': bd_map} return self.create_server(create_kwargs=create_kwargs) @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_multi_backend_boot(self): # NOTE(bkopilov):volume_type is not deleted -to fix backend1_name = CONF.volume.backend1_name backend2_name = CONF.volume.backend2_name volume_size = CONF.volume.volume_size # create a volume type by admin tenant for each backend self._create_volume_type(backend1_name) self._create_volume_type(backend2_name) # create a volume from image per backend type volume1 = self._create_volume_image_by_backend_name(volume_size, backend1_name) volume2 = self._create_volume_image_by_backend_name(volume_size, backend2_name) # boot an instance from volumes - volumes state is changed to in-use server1 = self._boot_instance_from_volume(volume1['id']) server2 = self._boot_instance_from_volume(volume2['id']) # create volumes in order to attach to nova instances volume_attach1 = self.create_volume(size=volume_size, volume_type=backend1_name) volume_attach2 = self.create_volume(size=volume_size, volume_type=backend2_name) # attaching volumes to existing instances self.volumes_client.attach_volume(volume_attach1['id'], server2['id'], '/dev/vdc') self.volumes_client.attach_volume(volume_attach2['id'], server1['id'], '/dev/vdc') # detaching volumes from instances self.volumes_client.detach_volume(volume_attach1['id']) self.volumes_client.detach_volume(volume_attach2['id'])

commit_message:
Test case to verify the vm port details

verify that VM (tenant's access point) port has the attribute listed
and is not  empty admin_state=True,host_id,vif_details',vif_type
verified image id and device_id are same

Change-Id: I447991d9259a77c690906c781ea2e3efc0899bf0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/137718/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._verify_port_vif_host_admin_state(self.primary_tenant) @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('compute', 'network') def _verify_port_vif_host_admin_state(self,tenant): """ verify that VM (tenant's access point) port has the attribute listed and is not empty admin_state=True,host_id,vif_details',vif_type verified image id and device_id are same """ name = data_utils.rand_name("tenantvm-") server = self._create_server(name, tenant) server_ip = self._get_server_ip(server) vm_image_id = server['id'] access_point_ssh = self._connect_to_access_point(tenant) # Get the required details of admin_state,binding:host_id, # binding:vif_details,binding:vif_type,fixed_ipsfields of all ports. # Select only those columns to reduce the size of the response. port_list = self._list_ports(fields=['admin_state_up', 'binding:host_id','binding:vif_details', 'binding:vif_type','fixed_ips','device_id']) for port in port_list: if port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address']== server_ip: self.assertTrue(port ['admin_state_up']) self.assertIsNotNone(port ['binding:host_id']) self.assertIsNotNone(port ['binding:vif_details']) self.assertIsNotNone(port ['binding:vif_type']) self.assertEqual(vm_image_id, port['device_id'])

commit_message:
Improvements into ssh and remote_client classes

Now it is possible to create tunneled ssh connections through a list
of gateways and provide particular timeout to exec_command.

Change-Id: I010a1b922c7d9c9d39435d60805e4d8d460fb8a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/62/119762/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time # Added a new parameter "GW" for allowing the use of multi host tunneling def __init__(self, server, username, password=None, pkey=None, gws=None): self.ssh_client = ssh.Client(ip_address, username, password, timeout=ssh_timeout, pkey=pkey, channel_timeout=ssh_channel_timeout, gws=gws) def exec_command(self, cmd, cmd_timeout=0): """ function that wraps the paramiko exec_command :param cmd: command to execute :param cmd_timeout: custom timeout for the concrete command to execute. :return: returns the contend of the execution """ return self.ssh_client.exec_command(cmd, cmd_timeout) return self.exec_command(cmd).split('\n')
deleted_lines: import time def __init__(self, server, username, password=None, pkey=None): self.ssh_client = ssh.Client(ip_address, username, password, ssh_timeout, pkey=pkey, channel_timeout=ssh_channel_timeout) def exec_command(self, cmd): return self.ssh_client.exec_command(cmd) return self.exec_command(cmd).split('\n')

commit_message:
cinder multibackend - attach and detach volumes from shared instance

Each cinder backend volume is attached and detached from shared
instance.
At the end of the test the instance is deleted.

Change-Id: Ic220c0e0c62efdeeb0b67c2cb7ab261e505f535e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/64/129464/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='gate') def test_backend_attach_detach_volume_to_instance(self): # This test creates a shared instance. each volume backend attached and # detached from the instance. the instance deleted at the end of # this test. srv_name = data_utils.rand_name('-Instance-') resp, server = self.servers_client.create_server(srv_name, self.image_ref, self.flavor_ref) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_status(server['id'], 'ACTIVE') # attach and detach to the instance each volume backend created for volume_id in self.volume_id_list_without_prefix\ + self.volume_id_list_with_prefix: mountpoint = '/dev/vdc' _, body = self.volume_client.attach_volume(volume_id, server['id'], mountpoint) self.volume_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume_id, 'in-use') _, body = self.volume_client.detach_volume(volume_id) self.volume_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume_id, 'available') # delete instance self.servers_client.delete_server(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_termination( server['id'])

commit_message:
Add ServerListMultiStatus test

Add a test checking that users can specify multiple status values when
requesting a list of servers.

Change-Id: Ifcbbcdcabf5fcf5f22cc02177c99b85961946be4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/29/135229/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='gate') def test_list_servers_multi_status(self): # List servers using multiple status values params = [{'status': 'shutoff'}, {'status': 'paused'}] self.client.stop(self.s1['id']) self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.s1['id'], 'SHUTOFF') self.client.pause_server(self.s2['id']) self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.s2['id'], 'PAUSED') resp, body = self.client.list_servers_with_detail(params) servers = body['servers'] self.assertIn(self.s1['id'], map(lambda x: x['id'], servers)) self.assertIn(self.s2['id'], map(lambda x: x['id'], servers)) self.assertNotIn(self.s3['id'], map(lambda x: x['id'], servers))

commit_message:
Quota tests don't take into account a limit of -1

-1 indicates no limit on the resource quota, but some tests add
a 1 to the current quota (which makes it 0) to expect an overlimit
exception, which is not correct.

Closes-Bug: #1348348

Change-Id: I7691a90d77f932113eda417f1a4bfbe128bc726d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/48/109148/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Quota limit of -1 indicates no limit if quota_set['ram'] is -1: return # Quota limit of -1 indicates no limit if quota_set['cores'] is -1: return

commit_message:
Add ServerUsage test

Add a test checking that the launched_at and the terminated_at parameters from
the ServerUsage extension are present and have the correct time format.

Change-Id: I919ed54355963a13e4a500195ced640c339a1541

commit_message:
Add API tests for update preview endpoint

Dependent on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122473/

Change-Id: Id5db70e7f74dc398d030a35ea61a54411a77cd5a
BP: update-dry-run
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/31/130631/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from tempest.api.orchestration import base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import test LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class UpdatePreviewTest(base.BaseOrchestrationTest): _tpl_type = 'yaml' _resource = 'resources' _type = 'type' @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(UpdatePreviewTest, cls).resource_setup() cls.stack_name = data_utils.rand_name('heat') template = cls.read_template('nova_keypair', ext=cls._tpl_type) # create the stack, avoid any duplicated key. cls.stack_identifier = cls.create_stack( cls.stack_name, template, parameters={ 'KeyPairName1': cls.stack_name + '_1', 'KeyPairName2': cls.stack_name + '_2' }) cls.stack_id = cls.stack_identifier.split('/')[1] cls.client.wait_for_stack_status(cls.stack_id, 'CREATE_COMPLETE') _, resources = cls.client.list_resources(cls.stack_identifier) cls.test_resources = {} for resource in resources: cls.test_resources[resource['logical_resource_id']] = resource @test.attr(type='gate') def test_created_resources(self): """Verifies created keypair resource.""" nova_keypair_template = self.load_template('nova_keypair', ext=self._tpl_type) resources = [('KeyPairSavePrivate', nova_keypair_template[self._resource][ 'KeyPairSavePrivate'][self._type]), ('KeyPairDontSavePrivate', nova_keypair_template[self._resource][ 'KeyPairDontSavePrivate'][self._type])] for resource_name, resource_type in resources: resource = self.test_resources.get(resource_name, None) self.assertIsInstance(resource, dict) self.assertEqual(resource_name, resource['logical_resource_id']) self.assertEqual(resource_type, resource['resource_type']) self.assertEqual('CREATE_COMPLETE', resource['resource_status']) @test.attr(type='gate') def test_preview_no_changes(self): template = self.read_template('nova_keypair', ext=self._tpl_type) resp, update_actions = self.client.preview_update_stack( self.stack_identifier, self.stack_name, template=template, parameters={ 'KeyPairName1': self.stack_name + '_1', 'KeyPairName2': self.stack_name + '_2' }) print update_actions self.assertIsInstance(update_actions, dict) self.assertIsInstance(update_actions.get('resource_changes'), dict) changes = update_actions['resource_changes'] self.assertTrue(len(changes['unchanged']) == 2) changes.pop('unchanged') for k in changes.keys(): self.assertTrue(not changes[k]) def test_preview_update_replace(self): template = self.read_template('nova_keypair', ext=self._tpl_type) resp, update_actions = self.client.preview_update_stack( self.stack_identifier, self.stack_name, template=template, parameters={ 'KeyPairName1': self.stack_name + '_3', #change keypair1 name 'KeyPairName2': self.stack_name + '_2' }) print update_actions self.assertIsInstance(update_actions, dict) self.assertIsInstance(update_actions.get('resource_changes'), dict) changes = update_actions['resource_changes'] self.assertTrue(len(changes['unchanged']) == 1) changes.pop('unchanged') self.assertTrue(len(changes['replaced']) == 1) changes.pop('replaced') for k in changes.keys(): self.assertTrue(not changes[k])

commit_message:
This test checks the basic firewall operations

    The following is the scenario outline:
    1. Create a network & subnet
    2. Create a router(if public router isn't configured).
    3. Connect tenant network to public network via router
    4. Create an access point:
        a. a security group open to incoming ssh connection
        b. a VM with a floating ip
    5. Create another network&subnet, connect network to the router
    6. Create a test VM, with security group open to  ICMP  traffic
    7. Ping test  from access point to test VM before creating and
       applying the firewall.
    8. Create a firewall with ICMP  deny rule.
    9. Ping test  from access point to test VM after applying firewall,
       ping should  fail.
    10. Delete the firwall.
    11. Ping test  from access point to test VM after deleting the firewall,
        ping should succeed.

Change-Id: I6991bcdda1e8de9873ad57f941ff1ee4c7cd48cc

commit_message:
Don't assume internal availability zone is the default

The CLI test test_admin_availability_zone_list checks the output of
"nova availability-zone-list" for the name "internal", which is the
default name of the internal availability zone. But this value is
user-settable in nova.conf. Instead of checking for "internal",
instead allow the user to specify the expected value in temest.conf

Change-Id: Ie323ec0f9815d086886418791a086b4f95c48798
Closes-Bug: #1392675

subject: Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - Tempest tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-12 20:01:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/52767c98989d2e5ff7b594b2c92c45d4212596f1', 'message': "Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - Tempest tests

Implements: blueprint glance-metadata-definitions-catalog-tests

Adding tempest tests for the new set of API's targeted for juno3
release in glance

Overview of API:
A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.

This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

Change-Id: I86a65d1b8938d76412c297cf6bf99e1a0f8b9f13

commit_message:
Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - Tempest tests

Implements: blueprint glance-metadata-definitions-catalog-tests

Adding tempest tests for the new set of API's targeted for juno3
release in glance

Overview of API:
A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.

This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

Change-Id: I86a65d1b8938d76412c297cf6bf99e1a0f8b9f13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/32/113632/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_glance_metadef_namespace_list(self): out = self.glance('--os-image-api-version=2 metadefs-namespace-list') endpoints = self.parser.listing(out) self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, [ 'namespace']) def test_glance_metadef_resource_type_list(self): out = self.glance( '--os-image-api-version=2 metadefs-resource-type-list') endpoints = self.parser.listing(out) self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, [ 'resource_type']) def test_glance_help_v2(self): help_text = self.glance('--os-image-api-version=2 help') lines = help_text.split('\n') self.assertFirstLineStartsWith(lines, 'usage: glance') commands = [] cmds_start = lines.index('Positional arguments:') cmds_end = lines.index('Optional arguments:') command_pattern = re.compile('^ {4}([a-z0-9\-\_]+)') for line in lines[cmds_start:cmds_end]: match = command_pattern.match(line) if match: commands.append(match.group(1)) commands = set(commands) wanted_commands = set(('image-create', 'image-delete', 'help', 'image-download', 'image-show', 'image-update', 'member-create', 'member-delete', 'member-list', 'image-list', 'metadefs-namespace-create', 'metadefs-namespace-delete', 'metadefs-namespace-import', 'metadefs-namespace-list', 'metadefs-namespace-objects-delete', 'metadefs-namespace-properties-delete', 'metadefs-namespace-resource-type-list', 'metadefs-namespace-show', 'metadefs-namespace-update', 'metadefs-object-create', 'metadefs-object-delete', 'metadefs-object-list', 'metadefs-object-show', 'metadefs-object-update', 'metadefs-property-create', 'metadefs-property-delete', 'metadefs-property-list', 'metadefs-property-show', 'metadefs-property-update', 'metadefs-resource-type-associate', 'metadefs-resource-type-deassociate', 'metadefs-resource-type-list')) self.assertFalse(wanted_commands - commands)

commit_message:
Add tool to prepare fixed isolated accounts

Change-Id: I55e99dc9c6095ce1d921a4f4f532e064105ffecd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/58/107758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright (c) 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import yaml import logging import sys # from tempest import auth from tempest import clients from tempest import exceptions from tempest.openstack.common import log as os_logging from tempest.common import isolated_creds # LOG = os_logging.getLogger(__name__) # use os_logging if we can force INFO+ to stderr here LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO) class AccountProvider(isolated_creds.IsolatedCreds): def gen_new_credentials(self, acc_num): suffix = '_%s' % acc_num creds = super(AccountProvider, self).gen_new_credentials( 'user', suffix=suffix) return {'username': creds.username.encode('utf-8'), 'password': creds.password.encode('utf-8'), 'tenant_name': creds.tenant_name.encode('utf-8')} class AccountProviderRaw(object): # FIXME(psedlak): Drop this, unless we decide to go for python-Xclients # In which case this could serve as draft. def __init__(self, password='pass', *args, **kwargs): super(AccountProviderRaw, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) # admin_creds = auth.KeystoneV2Credentials( # username=admin_name, # tenant_name=admin_tenant, # password=admin_pass) # os = clients.Manager(credentials=admin_creds) self.password = password os = clients.AdminManager() self.identity_admin_client = os.identity_client def gen_new_credentials(self, acc_num): roles = ('Member',) acc_name = 'tempest_%s' % acc_num LOG.info('Creating tenant %s', acc_name) _, tenant = self.identity_admin_client.create_tenant( name=acc_name, description=acc_name) LOG.info('Creating user %s', acc_name) _, user = self.identity_admin_client.create_user( acc_name, self.password, tenant['id'], '%s@example.org' % acc_name) for role in roles: self._assign_user_role(tenant, user, role) return {'username': user['username'].encode('utf-8'), 'password': self.password.encode('utf-8'), 'tenant_name': tenant['name'].encode('utf-8')} def _list_roles(self): _, roles = self.identity_admin_client.list_roles() return roles def _assign_user_role(self, tenant, user, role_name): role = None try: roles = self._list_roles() role = next(r for r in roles if r['name'] == role_name) except StopIteration: msg = 'No "%s" role found' % role_name raise exceptions.NotFound(msg) self.identity_admin_client.assign_user_role(tenant['id'], user['id'], role['id']) def main(): acc_pass = 'tempestSecret' # provider = AccountProviderRaw('tempest', password=acc_pass) provider = AccountProvider('tempest', password=acc_pass) accounts = [] for acc_num in range(int(sys.argv[1])): accounts.append( provider.gen_new_credentials(acc_num)) print(yaml.dump(accounts)) if __name__ == '__main__': # log to stderr log_root = os_logging.getLogger(None).logger streamlog = logging.StreamHandler(sys.stderr) streamlog.setLevel(logging.INFO) log_root.addHandler(streamlog) try: if (len(sys.argv) <= 1 or not sys.argv[1].isdigit() or int(sys.argv[1]) < 1): LOG.error('Please specify how many accounts should be created') sys.exit(1) main() except Exception as exc: LOG.exception(exc) raise

commit_message:
Adds ipv6 tests for Firewall as a service

Adds below tests
* test_create_update_delete_firewall_rule_extra_args

Partially implements: bp ipv6-api-testing-parity

Change-Id: I69751f803c91a0715c4c315ce7e9140660f77a63
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/84/126884/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common import custom_matchers cls.source_ips = {6: '2001::/64', 4: '10.20.0.0/32'} cls.dest_ips = {6: '2002::/64', 4: '10.30.0.0/32'} def _compare_resource_attrs(self, actual, expected): exclude_keys = set(actual).symmetric_difference(expected) self.assertThat(actual, custom_matchers.MatchesDictExceptForKeys( expected, exclude_keys)) def test_create_update_delete_firewall_rule_extra_args(self): # Create firewall rule kwargs = dict( name=data_utils.rand_name("fw-rule"), action="allow", protocol="tcp", description="dummy", shared=True, ip_version=self._ip_version, source_ip_address=self.source_ips[self._ip_version], destination_ip_address=self.dest_ips[self._ip_version], source_port="700", destination_port="400", enabled=False ) _, body = self.client.create_firewall_rule(**kwargs) self._compare_resource_attrs(body['firewall_rule'], kwargs) fw_rule_id = body['firewall_rule']['id'] # Update firewall rule if self._ip_version == 6: new_ip_version = 4 else: new_ip_version = 6 kwargs = dict( name=data_utils.rand_name("fw-rule"), action="deny", protocol="udp", description="changed", shared=False, ip_version=new_ip_version, source_ip_address=self.dest_ips[self._ip_version], destination_ip_address=self.source_ips[self._ip_version], source_port="800", destination_port="500", enabled=True ) _, body = self.client.update_firewall_rule(fw_rule_id, **kwargs) self._compare_resource_attrs(body['firewall_rule'], kwargs) # Delete firewall rule self.client.delete_firewall_rule(fw_rule_id) # Confirm deletion resp, fw_rules = self.client.list_firewall_rules() self.assertNotIn(fw_rule_id, [m['id'] for m in fw_rules['firewall_rules']]) class FWaaSExtensionIpV6TestJSON(FWaaSExtensionTestJSON): _ip_version = 6 @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): if not CONF.network_feature_enabled.ipv6: skip_msg = "IPv6 Tests are disabled." raise cls.skipException(skip_msg) super(FWaaSExtensionIpV6TestJSON, cls).resource_setup() class FWaaSExtensionIpV6TestXML(FWaaSExtensionIpV6TestJSON): _interface = 'xml'

subject: Fix translation proposals
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 17:18:50.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/129937a406a1d5f63f95293c0c14665085223703', 'message': "Fix translation proposals

Translation proposals have been changing files in the VENV directory
since the pull_from_zanata function downloads all files and it's not
clear which directories to use. The find there is from the top level.

Move the VENV to outside of the git tree to the tmp directory - like
it's done in all other cases for jenkins/scripts/. This also allows to
simplify the upstream_translation_update script.

Change-Id: Idf344d89691189c7c9ed46ef885433d3db14dff2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix translation proposals

Translation proposals have been changing files in the VENV directory
since the pull_from_zanata function downloads all files and it's not
clear which directories to use. The find there is from the top level.

Move the VENV to outside of the git tree to the tmp directory - like
it's done in all other cases for jenkins/scripts/. This also allows to
simplify the upstream_translation_update script.

Change-Id: Idf344d89691189c7c9ed46ef885433d3db14dff2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/23/324723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note that this directory needs to be outside of the source tree, # some other functions will fail if it's inside. VENV=$(mktemp -d)

commit_message:
Clarify use of cinder manage-snapshot command

The snapshot in the 'cinder mansage-snapshot' command refers
to a snapshot of a volume, but the documentation mentions
"A snapshot is an image created from a running instance". This is
misleading since that indicates that it is a Nova snapshot.
Also, it should be explicit that the volume refered to in the command
is the parent of the snapshot.

Change-Id: Ia958b571cbb59d5046661ff85f8545f4f56a140b

commit_message:
[cli-ref] Use Image API v2 at first

Image API v1 is supported, but v2 is preferred.

Change-Id: If3441c39120b953de9f2f8c23aa97ae88084fa70
Closes-Bug: #1585002

commit_message:
Convergence: DB api to get all active resources of stack

This patch reverts change I6a212da19a774239f014163774e75fe11dfe272c
and adds new DB api resource_get_all_active_by_stack to be used by
convergence.

The new DB api will be used while generating graph for convergence
stack and will fetch all resources of stack from DB excluding
the DELETE COMPLETE resources, if any.

Change-Id: I303ef2c9b5b6a0a49253425c00565c8981cc6825
Partial-Bug: #1528560

commit_message:
Optimize unit tests

There were some duplicated code that creates a cluster, node, profile or a
policy for testing. This patch consolidates those routines into a common
module.

Change-Id: Ifb9bbb0298df3cc47efb21c65c1ce9b67efb64b1

subject: Reduce READ_FREQ and TIMEOUT for watch-file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-19 19:03:15.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/watchers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/540b9a2baea820fef3c33fb88add2a968eb321f0', 'message': 'Reduce READ_FREQ and TIMEOUT for watch-file

The watch-file option currently relies on pyinotify which makes
use of select.poll. This is eventlet incompatible so it blocks
the whole thread for TIMEOUT milliseconds every READ_FREQ seconds.

This meant that an agent/service using this option is blocked for
500 milliseconds every 1 second.

Until a non-blocking alternative can be found, this adjusts the
READ_FREQ and TIMEOUT params on the FastWatchedFileHandler to
3 and 5 respectively. So every 3 seconds, it will block for 5
milliseconds so only 0.16% of time is lost instead of 50%.

Change-Id: I6fdc0a3f1eaae39eb86440c6c4b07ca8d91f2462
Partial-Bug: #1583270
(cherry picked from commit 6a36cffd9fdbedfe859ad52f4e8c44897f374cbd)
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce READ_FREQ and TIMEOUT for watch-file

The watch-file option currently relies on pyinotify which makes
use of select.poll. This is eventlet incompatible so it blocks
the whole thread for TIMEOUT milliseconds every READ_FREQ seconds.

This meant that an agent/service using this option is blocked for
500 milliseconds every 1 second.

Until a non-blocking alternative can be found, this adjusts the
READ_FREQ and TIMEOUT params on the FastWatchedFileHandler to
3 and 5 respectively. So every 3 seconds, it will block for 5
milliseconds so only 0.16% of time is lost instead of 50%.

Change-Id: I6fdc0a3f1eaae39eb86440c6c4b07ca8d91f2462
Partial-Bug: #1583270
(cherry picked from commit 6a36cffd9fdbedfe859ad52f4e8c44897f374cbd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/79/318879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: READ_FREQ = 5 TIMEOUT = 5

commit_message:
Fix GetAttThenSelect for convergence

The GetAttThenSelect dep_attrs implementaion is changed to return the
attribute only instead of (attribute + path component). It is wrong to
return the (attribute + path component) and that was breaking the
GetAttThenSelect for convergence.

Change-Id: I117dc3e587386f4d48e70ef89c61bb857c751717
Closes-Bug: #1582649

commit_message:
Minor tweak versioned object implementation

This patch defines "_from_db_object" method in base
class of Senlin versioned object. Subclasses which
have special cases to deal with can override this
function.

Change-Id: Ic14e572654f3583bf64ffe7575e8bf7d6c22efb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/98/324298/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, obj, db_obj): if db_obj is None: return None for field in obj.fields: if field == 'metadata': obj['metadata'] = db_obj['meta_data'] else: obj[field] = db_obj[field] obj._context = context obj.obj_reset_changes() return obj

commit_message:
Unify the naming of tempest API test cases

This patch tries to unify the naming of tempest API test
functions according to the following rule:
 - "test_$RESOURCE_$OP"

$RESOURCE is noun, e.g. cluster and $OP is verb, e.g. create.

Change-Id: I787a3e2e2a38e8d0d32109d2e60c16e3ab5352e0

commit_message:
Fix typo in tutorial about removing node

"$ senlin cluster-node-add -n newnode mycluster"
needs to be changed to:
"$ senlin cluster-node-del -n newnode mycluster"

Change-Id: Iec56c31b2c2ec7a0fe773c82a56fdea837c9e069
Closes-Bug: 1588301
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/02/325002/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ senlin cluster-node-del -n oldnode mycluster $ senlin node-show oldnode
deleted_lines: $ senlin cluster-node-add -n newnode mycluster $ senlin node-show newnode

commit_message:
Install missing package in spiceproxy container

nova-spicehtml5proxy service fails on RPM-based systems unless the
spice-html5 RPM is also installed.

Closes-Bug: #1569709
(cherry picked from commit d47f6bc90cc3572890a5d99588bbc9ec3a4ca42c)

commit_message:
Increase test coverage on preprov creds

Add a few more tests for the preprovisioned credential provider,
for the get_*_creds methods that were not explicitly covered until
now. Fixing a small issue that was detected by the new tests, when
no credentials of one type are defined in the YAML file, the wrong
exception was raised.

Change-Id: I5727baf95f50e55aff17232862c2b0705f1eb743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/62/324662/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if len(useable_hashes) == 0: msg = 'No users configured for type/roles %s' % roles raise lib_exc.InvalidCredentials(msg)

commit_message:
Switch Cinder Api/Scheduler/Volume to composable roles

Uses a shared cinder-base resource to do the database
and messaging configuration for all three services.

Depends-On: I3c6d5226eed5f0f852b0ad9476c7cd9a959fda69
Change-Id: I47c5fd190efca5f02e73fd22aba6cda573daf5cc

commit_message:
Make available to log encoded strings as arguments

Pure python logging library allows to log encoded strings
but in oslo_log it causes UnicodeDecodeError for arguments
which contains unicode symbols.

Changes add additional check whether all arguments can be converted to
unicode. If it isn't possible then leave it as is.

Change-Id: I76e75c35a74b146fae52c0ea60156e1cf78540e7
Closes-Bug: #1563295

added_lines: # == Class: watcher::keystone::auth # # Configures watcher user, service and endpoint in Keystone. # # === Parameters # # [*password*] # (required) Password for watcher user. # # [*auth_name*] # Username for watcher service. Defaults to 'watcher'. # # [*email*] # Email for watcher user. Defaults to 'watcher@localhost'. # # [*tenant*] # Tenant for watcher user. Defaults to 'services'. # # [*configure_endpoint*] # Should watcher endpoint be configured? Defaults to 'true'. # # [*configure_user*] # (Optional) Should the service user be configured? # Defaults to 'true'. # # [*configure_user_role*] # (Optional) Should the admin role be configured for the service user? # Defaults to 'true'. # # [*service_type*] # Type of service. Defaults to 'key-manager'. # # [*region*] # Region for endpoint. Defaults to 'RegionOne'. # # [*service_name*] # (optional) Name of the service. # Defaults to the value of auth_name. # # [*service_description*] # (optional) Description of the service. # Default to 'watcher API Service' # # [*public_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's public url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:9322') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*admin_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's admin url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:9322') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*internal_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's internal url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:9322') # class watcher::keystone::auth ( $password, $auth_name = 'watcher', $email = 'watcher@localhost', $tenant = 'services', $configure_endpoint = true, $configure_user = true, $configure_user_role = true, $service_name = undef, $service_description = 'Infrastructure Optimization service', $service_type = 'infra-optim', $region = 'RegionOne', $public_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:9322', $admin_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:9322', $internal_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:9322', ) { $real_service_name = pick($service_name, $auth_name) if $configure_user_role { Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'watcher-server' |> } Keystone_endpoint["${region}/${real_service_name}::${service_type}"] ~> Service <| name == 'watcher-server' |> keystone::resource::service_identity { 'watcher': configure_user => $configure_user, configure_user_role => $configure_user_role, configure_endpoint => $configure_endpoint, service_name => $real_service_name, service_type => $service_type, service_description => $service_description, region => $region, auth_name => $auth_name, password => $password, email => $email, tenant => $tenant, public_url => $public_url, internal_url => $internal_url, admin_url => $admin_url, } }

subject: Create symlink for libvirt save directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 17:16:19.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_nova/tasks/nova_pre_install.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/symlink_libvirt_save_dir_to_nova_dir-eb1ec5c7a415393d.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a2adac22216686c38a2dca6992d41cea9090f992', 'message': "Create symlink for libvirt save directory

Nova can fill up the partition that /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save is on
when nova calls `image-create` on an instance. This occurs because nova
calls libvirt with managedsave which creates a temporary file in the
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save location. Libvirt does not allow the location
of /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save to be configurable so we have to manage it
ourselves via bindmounts or symlinks. In this commit we remove the
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save directory and create a symlink in it's place,
pointing to `{{ nova_system_home_folder }}/save` instead (which we also
create). This location was chosen as deployers often have more space
here for nova instances.

Change-Id: I5c96f70aa355cc02379fe7e0681416eca53447eb
Partial-Bug: #1585325
"}]
commit_message:
Create symlink for libvirt save directory

Nova can fill up the partition that /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save is on
when nova calls `image-create` on an instance. This occurs because nova
calls libvirt with managedsave which creates a temporary file in the
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save location. Libvirt does not allow the location
of /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save to be configurable so we have to manage it
ourselves via bindmounts or symlinks. In this commit we remove the
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save directory and create a symlink in it's place,
pointing to `{{ nova_system_home_folder }}/save` instead (which we also
create). This location was chosen as deployers often have more space
here for nova instances.

Change-Id: I5c96f70aa355cc02379fe7e0681416eca53447eb
Partial-Bug: #1585325
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/21/324721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if qemu save directory is a directory stat: path: "/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save" register: qemu_savedir_stat - name: Check if qemu save directory is empty shell: 'ls -1A /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save' register: qemu_savedir_empty # We force the link creation if our tests passed, this removes the directory as # well - name: Symlink qemu save dir to nova_libvirt_save_path file: path: "/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save" state: link owner: "{{ nova_qemu_user }}" group: "{{ nova_qemu_group }}" src: "{{ nova_libvirt_save_path }}" force: True when: - qemu_savedir_stat.stat.isdir - qemu_savedir_empty.stdout_lines | length == 0

configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins.

commit_message:
Revert to test role master branches for Newton-2 development

The changes in https://review.openstack.org/324748 were implemented
in order to fix all roles for the Newton-1 test deliverable.

This patch reverts the roles tested to the head of the master branch
for continued work towards Newton-2.

Change-Id: I6e5c19ad59742988da85e555203423e5e7e25717

commit_message:
Remove duplicated logic about oslo notifier

In a previous patch, we added a duplicated module for RPC notifier. It
seems not necessary at all. This patch removes it. This patch also
removes some unnecessary logics in the common messaging module.

Change-Id: I96e4ef9e7cdeb77b30f2f3379a6b02c6a70ea0aa

commit_message:
Neutron 16.04 support

Like glance because that was awesome work.
Ubuntu 16.04 requires a few changes:
- bridge-utils needs to be installed on linux bridge agents
- Namespaces get listed as <namespacename> (id: <id>) instead of only
  <namespacename> which causes our tests to fail.

Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
Implements: blueprint support-ubuntu-1604
Change-Id: I94723d512097b9b1f767262bde534d89cfeb1408
