subject: Neutron Routed Networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 20:52:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/d768b2a99d666d8ce4f0370c38ddf3a788c759e5', 'message': 'Neutron Routed Networks

In Neutron, there is a priority effort to support routed networks.  A
routed network in this context, is a physical network infrastructure
that implements scaled networks by routing instead of large L2
broadcast domains.  For example, deployers may have routers at each
top-of-rack.  Instead of a single VLAN covering the deployment, each
rack would have its own VLAN and the routers will provide reachability
to the rest of the racks over L3.  Operators want Neutron to model
this like a single network.  This has implications for Nova scheduling
and possibly migration.

Change-Id: I8f5523930d360a9183ab111e015ef4b052e0968f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-28 21:06:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/ffa82c3cf45ffb417cddffa4604e95732dfc61fa', 'message': 'Neutron Routed Networks

commit_message:
Neutron Routed Networks

In Neutron, there is a effort to support routed provider networks.  A
routed network in this context, is a physical network infrastructure
that implements scaled networks by routing instead of large L2
broadcast domains.  For example, deployers may have routers at each
top-of-rack.  Instead of a single VLAN covering the deployment, each
rack would have its own VLAN and the routers will provide reachability
to the rest of the racks over L3.  Operators want Neutron to model
this like a single network.  This has implications for Nova
scheduling.

Depends-On: I1a71e83d9fb3d13306979934fbd11faf80091ab8
Change-Id: I8f5523930d360a9183ab111e015ef4b052e0968f
Related-Bug: #1458890
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/98/263898/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= Neutron Routed Networks ======================= .. TODO Blueprint doesn't exist yet. Should it? https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/neutron-routed-networks In Neutron, there is a priority effort to support routed networks. A routed network, in this context, is a physical network infrastructure that implements scaled networks by routing instead of large L2 broadcast domains. For example, deployers may have routers at each top-of-rack. Instead of a single VLAN covering the deployment, each rack would have its own VLAN and the routers will provide reachability to the rest of the racks over L3. `Operators want Neutron to model this like a single network`__. This has implications for Nova scheduling and possibly migration. __ operators-rfe_ Problem description =================== `Neutron has a spec`__ under active review for how this will be handled in Neutron. Each L2 network is referred to as a segment. Other terminology is in discussion in the spec. __ neutron-spec_ For Nova, this has a couple of specific implications. First, IP subnets will have affinity to particular network segments. Second, compute hosts will have L2 reachability to (typically) only one segment within an network. This means that IP addresses assigned to ports are constrained to a potentially small subset of compute hosts. Currently, Nova requires an IP address on a port. If this requirement is kept, and that IP address is constrained to a small subset of compute hosts then the scheduler would have to constrain scheduling to that subset. This is not ideal. It is an artificial constraint on the scheduler and is pretty severe. To avoid this constraint on the scheduler, Neutron needs to be able to leave the IP address unassigned until after the port is bound to a host. A related implication is that some segments may have subnets that are exhausted meaning no IP availability for that segment. Other segments will normally still have them available. Operators would like IP availability considered by the scheduler. This is a resource that is under the control of Neutron. This links this spec with the `spec about adding resource providers`__. __ resource-providers-spec_ For live migration, the VM already has an IP address. For that IP address to continue to work, the VM must be migrated to another host with reachability to the same network segment. Otherwise, migration must be enhanced to either allow changing the IP in the VM to one that is viable on the new segment or using a routing protocol and proxy arp to move the IP to another segment. I'm not sure if the former option is viable in Nova at all. The latter is currently out of plan in Neutron. Use Cases ---------- This is mostly a deployer use case. Neutron is working to minimize impact to end users. However, booting VMs on to a network may have some visible effect on end users. For example, they may boot two VMs and discover that the two VMs cannot reach each other over L2. However, they can expect them to be reachable over L3. End users will be able to look at the new boolean *l2-adjacency* flag on their network to set this expectation. Deployer impact is discussed in the `Neutron spec`__. Deployers will make the decision to deploy a network that does not support guaranteed L2 reachability throughout. They'll need to consider the effect of this on their end users. __ neutron-spec_ Project Priority ----------------- Not yet. ;) However, this is a priority for Neutron. Please consider that in your prioritization. Proposed change =============== TODO Alternatives ------------ TODO Data model impact ----------------- TODO REST API impact --------------- TODO Security impact --------------- TODO Notifications impact -------------------- TODO Other end user impact --------------------- TODO Performance Impact ------------------ TODO Other deployer impact --------------------- TODO Developer impact ---------------- TODO Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- TODO Work Items ---------- TODO Dependencies ============ This is co-dependent on the `Neutron spec`__ mentioned. There may be some ways to break out a piece of that spec and have this dependent on only that piece. However, the Neutron portion of this is dependent on this Nova spec. __ neutron-spec_ This also depends on adding the `concept of resource providers`__ to Nova which is currently under discussion within the scheduler subteam. __ resource-providers-spec_ Testing ======= TODO Documentation Impact ==================== TODO References ========== .. _operators-rfe: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1458890 .. _neutron-spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225384/ .. _resource-providers-spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225546/ History ======= None

commit_message:
Always execute Nova virt type detection

This fix executes the nova virt type detection on any playbook run
and will eliminate the need to specify the nova-cpuinfo-read,
nova-virt-type-set tags along with the intended tag like nova-config.

Change-Id: Ic34011149f1355cfa48f4ee35537362e2d24e55d
Closes-Bug: #1587452

commit_message:
Tacker and networking-sfc Integration

This is the spec for the Tacker driver that will interface
with the networking-sfc API for service chaining.

 Co-Authored-By: Cathy Hong Zhang <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>
 Co-Authored-By: Stephen Wong <stephen.kf.wong@gmail.com>
 Co-Authored-By: Farhad Sunavala <farhad.sunavala@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I664ce668f8b2066743622f1f184f9600ac9489f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/71/290771/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Tacker & networking-sfc Integration =================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/tacker-sfc This specification describes a driver for Tacker that will interface with the port-chain API of the `Neutron networking-sfc <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-sfc/>`_ project. The `Tacker API <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Tacker>`_ provides for the management of Service VNFs and with [1], provides support for the creation of VNF Forwarding Graphs (VNFFG). A VNFFG is a sequence of VNFs and the classifiers that select the traffic to flow through the VNFFG. Problem description =================== Tacker VNFFG and Neutron networking-sfc operate on two different levels of abstraction. While Neutron networking-sfc constructs a service chain via stitching together a list of Neutron ports, and is generally service agnostic, Tacker VNFFG operates on service instance or even higher service type constructs (such as 'load-balancer', 'firewall'...etc). Proposed changes ================ The new networking-sfc driver for Tacker will map from the high-level abstract description of a VNFFG to a Neutron port description of a VNFFG, namely a port-chain. The diagram below shows the networking-sfc driver integrated with the Tacker VNFFG plugin and the Tacker VNF Manager (VNFM) Plugin in the Tacker Server. VNFFG extension has a dependency on VNFM extension. :: +---------------------------------------------+ | Client Application | +-----------+---------------------+-----------+ | Tacker VNFFG API | Tacker VNFM API +-----------|---------------------|-----------+ | v v | | +-----------------+ +----------------+ | | | Tacker | | Tacker | | | | VNFFG Extension | | VNFM Extension | | | | Plugin/DB | | Plugin | | | +--------+--------+ +----------------+ | | | | | | +==========================+ | | | networking-sfc | | | | Port Chain Driver | | | +==========================+ | | Tacker Server | | +----------------------|----------------------+ | Port Chain API +----------------------|----------------------+ | Neutron Server v | | +-------------------+ | | | networking-sfc | | | | Port Chain Plugin | | | +-------------------+ | +---------------------------------------------+ The VNFFG plugin will pass the VNFFG CRUD operations to the networking-sfc driver. The driver will map the VNFFG CRUD operations to port-chain CRUD operations and call the port-chain API of the networking-sfc Port Chain plugin. The networking-sfc driver also interface with the Tacker VNFM to retrieve VNF instances in the case where the VNFFG specified in terms of abstract VNF types. The networking-sfc driver will include the following functionality: * Map a VNFFG chain definition to a networking-sfc port-chain definition. * The driver will format port-chain CRUD operations and call the port-chain API. * If the VNFFG is expressed as a sequence of abstract VNF types, the driver will query the VNFM plugin to retrieve the VNF instances that can be used to support the desired abstract VNF types. The query operation will contain a filter that specifies the abstract VNF type and additional type-specific metadata. The VNFM may indicate that there is no matching VNF instance available to support the desired abstract VNF type specified in the query. The VNFM may return one or more VNF instances that are able to support the desired VNF type. * If the VNFM returns multiple VNF instances that can be used for scaling of a given VNF stage in the VNFFG, the driver will create a port-pair-group that includes all the VNF instances returned by the VNFM. * If the VNFM includes a scaling sub-system that manages VNF scale-out and scale-in operations, the scaling sub-system can call the networking-sfc driver to update a port-pair-group to add or remove port-pairs that represent the VNFs. * If a VNFFG is specified as symmetrical, the driver will create two identical unidirectional port-chains, one with VNFs in the reverse order of the other, and also reversed flow classifier * Map the VNFFG classifier to a flow-classifier for the port chain. * as the flow-classifier defined in Tacker VNFFG currently contains more matching fields --- those that aren't supported by networking-sfc would simply be resulting in unimplemented exception. * The default driver of Tacker VNFFG will become 'networking-sfc' The current flow of Tacker VNFFG --- in stage and deploy a chain, follows the following workflow :: tacker vnffg-create --name mychain --chain testVNF2,testVNF1 --symmetrical True or:: tacker vnffg-create --name mychain --chain firewall,nat --abstract-types tacker vnffg-classifier-create --name myclass --chain mychain --match tcp_dest=80,ip_proto=6 so in this API set, the chain is created (and deployed) before a classifier can be associated with it. networking-sfc follows the following workflow:: neutron port-pair-create --ingress <port-id> --egress <port-id> neutron port-pair-group-create --port-pairs <port-pair-id> neutron flow-classifier-create --protocol tcp --destination-port 80:80 neutron port-chain-create --port-pair-group <port-pair-group-id> --flow-classifier <classifier-id> <name> a port-chain can be created without flow-classifier, but the network plumbing would be configured after the port-chain-create command. The mapping of Tacker VNFFG APIs to Neutron networking-sfc client calls:: +---------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Tacker VNFFG APIs | networking-sfc client CLI | +-----------------------------+---------------------------------------+ | | | | create_chain | neutron port-pair-create | | | --ingress [Neutron port] | | | --egress [Neutron port] | | | | | | neutron port-pair-group-create | | | --port-pairs [port pair id] | | | | | | neutron port-chain-create | | | --port-pair-group <id> | +-----------------------------+---------------------------------------+ | | | | create_classifier | neutron flow-classifier-create | | | [parameters] | | | | | | neutron port-chain-update | | | --flow-classifier <fc-id> | | | <chain-id> | +-----------------------------+---------------------------------------+ Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- User would need to specify the backend driver for networking-sfc via Neutron config file. By default it will be OVS driver. Developer impact ---------------- The ODL SFC driver under Tacker VNFFG will be obsolete as soon as ODL SFC driver becomes available under networking-sfc after this integration work is done. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- * Stephen Wong (stephen.kf.wong@gmail.com) * Cathy Zhang (cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com) * Louis Fourie (louis.fourie@huawei.com) * Farhad Sunavala (farhad.sunavala@huawei.com) Work Items ---------- 1. Add new driver 'networking-sfc' for Tacker VNFFG extension. * Add mapping from VNFFG chain definition to port-chain. * Add mapping from VNFFG classifier to port-chain flow-classifier. * Add query to VNFM to retrieve VNF instances. 2. Add unit tests for all of the above. 3. Integrate with networking-sfc port-chain. 4. devstack config to include networking-sfc. Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Unit tests and function tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [1] https://github.com/openstack/tacker-specs/blob/master/specs/liberty/tacker-sfc.rst

commit_message:
Setting default runlevel/target to non-graphical

This patch disables the graphical interface on a system to meet the STIG's
requirements. This was only a check previously. Deployers have the option
to opt out of this change if they *really* need a graphical interface.

Documentation updates and a release note are included.

Change-Id: Ia4c4853f7c9b66c6e1ac91c46fb8e7d48c80a408
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/30/321130/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # The STIG does not allow the system to run a graphical interface. Set this # variable to 'no' if you need a graphical interface on the server. security_disable_x_windows: yes # V-38674

commit_message:
Don't start LSM in check mode

This patch checks to see if the role is being run in check mode. If it
is in check mode, the AppArmor service will not be started and the
SELinux configuration will not be adjusted.

Change-Id: Iae976f283df77556a71833f857a906097e6f8aeb

commit_message:
Initialize alembic branches for TaaS repo

Add alembic migration branch for tap-as-a-service repo. Scripts
for new tables owned by TaaS must now be added here.
Also adds PEP8 changes to check migration branch points.

Closes-Bug: #1583889
Change-Id: I6d03090c3c90bf7d05eddafa5ac7e502cc13cfe8

commit_message:
loadbalancer: remove controller_host

controller_host was deprecated and is not used anymore anywhere.
Let's drop it.
Also make controller_hosts really required, by not setting a default
paramter, so Puppet catalog will fail if no value is given.

Change-Id: Iad760115f925e848e4b72009db5177f88ceb4ad8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/55/323955/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (Required) IPs of host or group of hosts to load-balance the services $controller_hosts, $controller_hosts_real = any2array($controller_hosts)
deleted_lines: # [*controller_host*] # (Deprecated)Host or group of hosts to load-balance the services # Can be a string or an array. # Defaults to undef ## IPs of host or group of hosts to load-balance the services# Defaults to undef $controller_host = undef, $controller_hosts = undef, if !$controller_host and !$controller_hosts { fail('$controller_hosts or $controller_host (now deprecated) is a mandatory parameter') } if $controller_hosts { $controller_hosts_real = any2array($controller_hosts) } else { warning('$controller_host has been deprecated in favor of $controller_hosts') $controller_hosts_real = any2array($controller_host) }

commit_message:
Make username and project use same random ID

Username and project name generated by dynamic credentials use
to different random IDs, which makes it difficult to relate them
when looking at log files. Use the same ID for both.

Change-Id: I91df48152f848bbdf1e1450e88be3c1cb04960af

commit_message:
Remove FIPs graphing from OSIC

Since OSIC removed the need for FIPs, we can also remove the data from
grafana.o.o.

Change-Id: I18a8f02385a8d24c5217303e7a81482c6497e2e0
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add DBM cache backend that uses memcached locking

This commit adds a new dogpile.cache backend that uses the memcached
distributed locking mechanism to enable async workers but still uses
the dbm file storage. This should enable us to cache large JSON blobs
without worrying about the memacached size constraints, but at the
same time reap the benefits of having an async worker update the
cache in the background. The tradeoff here is configuration complexity
because you still need to install memcached to leverage this.

Change-Id: Ied241ca1762c62a047bd366d7bd105028a884f30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/94/324094/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from dogpile.cache.backends import memcached from dogpile.cache import compat from dogpile.cache import proxy from dogpile.cache import util import pylibmc class MemcachedLockedDBMProxy(proxy.ProxyBackend): def __init__(self, url, binary=False, behaviors=None, lock_timeout=0): super(MemcachedLockedDBMProxy, self).__init__() self.lock_timeout = lock_timeout self.url = url self.binary = binary self.behaviors = behaviors or {} @util.memoized_property def _clients(self): backend = self class ClientPool(compat.threading.local): def __init__(self): self.memcached = backend._create_client() return ClientPool() @property def client(self): """Return the memcached client. This uses a threading.local by default as it appears most modern memcached libs aren't inherently threadsafe. """ return self._clients.memcached def _create_client(self): return pylibmc.Client(self.url, binary=self.binary, behaviors=self.behaviors) def get_mutex(self, key): return memcached.MemcachedLock(lambda: self.client, key, timeout=self.lock_timeout)

subject: A helper script to launch quickstart from a usbkey
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 16:37:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/f0b00febc372f336464b5279c324f5b212402e84', 'message': 'A helper script to launch quickstart from a usbkey

The rdo team would like a usbkey loaded w/ quickstart and the

commit_message:
A helper script to launch quickstart from a usbkey

The rdo team would like a usbkey loaded w/ quickstart and the
quickstart image of the latest rdo version.  This script is
meant to enable a successful run for a user with no experience

Change-Id: I15e1eef6a47283f61e00f1e12c2b2a2c98574aed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/45/319345/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -e ###################################################################### # This script is part of the ooo-quickstart usbkey. It's designed # to execute the quickstart from a usbkey on a test machine directly. # ###################################################################### #launch quickstart using the local image against the localhost export COMMAND="./quickstart.sh --undercloud-image-url file://$PWD/undercloud.qcow2 localhost" #check if the current user is root if [[ $USER != root ]]; then echo "root user is required, exiting" exit fi echo "================================================================" echo "Ensure ssh keys are properly seutp" KEY=/root/.ssh/id_rsa AUTHORIZED_KEYS=/root/.ssh/authorized_keys #check if a ssh key exists if [ ! -f "$KEY" ]; then echo "ssh key $KEY not found, we will create one" ssh-keygen -t rsa -N "" -f $KEY fi #check if the authorized_keys file exists if [ ! -f /root/.ssh/authorized_keys ]; then cat $KEY.pub >> $AUTHORIZED_KEYS chmod 0600 $AUTHORIZED_KEYS echo "An ssh key has been added to the created authorized_key file" echo "" fi # check if the public key is in the authorized keys file if grep -q -s `cat $KEY.pub` $AUTHORIZED_KEYS; then echo "Found $KEY.pub content in $AUTHORIZED_KEYS" else cat $KEY.pub >> $AUTHORIZED_KEYS echo "The $KEY.pub ssh key has been added to $AUTHORIZED_KEYS" fi echo "The ssh keys are properly seutp" echo "================================================================" echo "Running tripelo-quickstart in 15 seconds w/ the following command" echo "" echo "See https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart for the latest" echo "documenation and source code" echo "================================================================" echo "" echo $COMMAND sleep 15 $COMMAND

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for Newton-1 2016-06-02

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available SHA's,
updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's and also updates the
appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: Ifc77c02d456500651e8adcaf9338f81601e2c148

added_lines: --- features: - | Horizon's IPv6 support is now enabled by default. This allows users to manage subnets with IPv6 addresses within the Horizon interface. Deployers can disable IPv6 support in Horizon by setting the following variable: .. code-block:: yaml horizon_enable_ipv6: False Please note: Horizon will still display IPv6 addresses in various panels with IPv6 support disabled. However, it will not allow any direct management of IPv6 configuration.

Replace obsolete way of get creds in tempest tests

Tempest now uses 'get_configured_admin_credentials' instead of
'get_configured_credentials' which we still use in murano.

Closes-Bug: #1586912

commit_message:
Working Hot Stanby HA on any driver of oslo.messaging

Current Congress supports Hot Stanby HA in old/new architecture.
In new architecture, if a driver of oslo.messaging shares its
messaging topic namespace among multi DseNode, RPC from each
DseNode will be mixed up and doesn't work correctly.

This patch separates each the topic namespace by adding a topic
partition DseNode uses.

Closes-Bugs: 1585975
Change-Id: I6763248faf0f81d53f2970274903b9c035a51eed

commit_message:
Relax hz-table parent requirement

hz-expand-detail is a pretty handy directive to use in normal
HTML tables. This patch changes the parent directive requirement
to be optional.

Change-Id: Ic0b0c7af6143ec1d654cb277503342693d051b50
Closes-Bug: #1580809

commit_message:
Drop tripleo-image-elements from requirements process

1) It's not being used
http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5Etripleo-image-elements&i=nope&files=.*requirements.txt&repos=

2) It's not in sync with other things in g-r/uc
http://logs.openstack.org/18/323318/5/check/gate-requirements-tox-py27-with-upper-constraints/da59be4/console.html#_2016-05-31_17_20_42_554

Change-Id: I51444bba94f3932fdb65d6cc7d409e52ad5babef

commit_message:
Check conflicts script

Use pkg_resources.require to report conflicts to ensure
co-installability.

Co-Authored-By: Igor Yozhikov <iyozhikov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7443496b6a06d02bb9cc9457b729dea71451f44a

commit_message:
Revert "Configure Cinder backend sections for controllers"

This reverts commit 1c920488e7c1c00b4df815974458cca638af7952.

Change-Id: I177b3fdbe0a73e68fa7de3fb00fb6a22eb6de46b
Closes-Bug: #1588527
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/70/324770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: should contain_cinder__backend__iscsi('DEFAULT').with( should contain_cinder__backend__rbd('DEFAULT').with(
deleted_lines: should contain_cinder__backend__iscsi(volume_backend_name['volumes_lvm']).with( should contain_cinder__backend__rbd(volume_backend_name['volumes_ceph']).with( is_expected.to contain_class('cinder::backends') is_expected.to_not contain_class('cinder::backends')

subject: Remove legacy v2 API code completely
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 02:27:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/885c30c2e8c5337b402857d449378f55b4193eec', 'message': 'WIP: Remove legacy v2 API code completely

There are two implementation code for similar API in Nova repository.
One is newer: v2.1 API, another is legacy: v2 API. v2.1 API has been
used as the default API since Liberty and legacy v2 API has been marked
as deprecated. We have used and tested v2.1 API so well and now is nice
time to remove legacy API code based on the consensus of the design
summit of Austin.

This patch removes the legacy code completely.

NOTE: The gate job which used the legacy code has been removed already
      since Iac81b7d569b76b99e9d86eaa5001ae7f9b78cdfe.
NOTE: Many developers took much burden for maintaining both APIs in
      long term. I am really happy to remove this code, and let's say
      "good bye forever" :-)

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: Ieb8374bff81b26c680cae6e6ca92ab736209570d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-02 03:01:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6a41b1df384295d65b6e5bafaed4738636e9915e', 'message': 'WIP: Remove legacy v2 API code completely

'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/server_external_events.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/floating_ip_dns.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a31d917af0cc5ecb55424598e7b812e02afbf28c', 'message': 'Remove legacy v2 API code completely

There are two implementation code for similar API in Nova repository.
One is newer: v2.1 API, another is legacy: v2 API. v2.1 API has been
used as the default API since Liberty and legacy v2 API has been marked
as deprecated. We have used and tested v2.1 API so well and now is nice
time to remove legacy API code based on the consensus of the design
summit of Austin.

This patch removes the legacy code completely.

NOTE: The gate job which used the legacy code has been removed already
      since Iac81b7d569b76b99e9d86eaa5001ae7f9b78cdfe.

commit_message:
Remove legacy v2 API code completely

There are two implementation code for similar API in Nova repository.
One is newer: v2.1 API, another is legacy: v2 API. v2.1 API has been
used as the default API since Liberty and legacy v2 API has been marked
as deprecated. We have used and tested v2.1 API so well and now is nice
time to remove legacy API code based on the consensus of the design
summit of Austin.

This patch removes the legacy code completely.

NOTE: The gate job which used the legacy code has been removed already
      since Iac81b7d569b76b99e9d86eaa5001ae7f9b78cdfe.
NOTE: Many developers took much burden for maintaining both APIs in
      long term. I am really happy to remove this code, and let's say
      "good bye forever" :-)

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: Ieb8374bff81b26c680cae6e6ca92ab736209570d

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import urllib from oslo_utils import netutils import webob from nova.api.openstack import extensions from nova.api.openstack import wsgi from nova import context as nova_context from nova import exception from nova.i18n import _ from nova import network authorize = extensions.extension_authorizer('compute', 'floating_ip_dns') def _translate_dns_entry_view(dns_entry): result = {} result['ip'] = dns_entry.get('ip') result['id'] = dns_entry.get('id') result['type'] = dns_entry.get('type') result['domain'] = dns_entry.get('domain') result['name'] = dns_entry.get('name') return {'dns_entry': result} def _translate_dns_entries_view(dns_entries): return {'dns_entries': [_translate_dns_entry_view(entry)['dns_entry'] for entry in dns_entries]} def _translate_domain_entry_view(domain_entry): result = {} result['domain'] = domain_entry.get('domain') result['scope'] = domain_entry.get('scope') result['project'] = domain_entry.get('project') result['availability_zone'] = domain_entry.get('availability_zone') return {'domain_entry': result} def _translate_domain_entries_view(domain_entries): return {'domain_entries': [_translate_domain_entry_view(entry)['domain_entry'] for entry in domain_entries]} def _unquote_domain(domain): """Unquoting function for receiving a domain name in a URL. Domain names tend to have .'s in them. Urllib doesn't quote dots, but Routes tends to choke on them, so we need an extra level of by-hand quoting here. """ return urllib.unquote(domain).replace('%2E', '.') def _create_dns_entry(ip, name, domain): return {'ip': ip, 'name': name, 'domain': domain} def _create_domain_entry(domain, scope=None, project=None, av_zone=None): return {'domain': domain, 'scope': scope, 'project': project, 'availability_zone': av_zone} class FloatingIPDNSDomainController(object): """DNS domain controller for OpenStack API.""" def __init__(self): self.network_api = network.API() super(FloatingIPDNSDomainController, self).__init__() def index(self, req): """Return a list of available DNS domains.""" context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context) try: domains = self.network_api.get_dns_domains(context) except NotImplementedError: msg = _("Unable to get dns domain") raise webob.exc.HTTPNotImplemented(explanation=msg) domainlist = [_create_domain_entry(domain['domain'], domain.get('scope'), domain.get('project'), domain.get('availability_zone')) for domain in domains] return _translate_domain_entries_view(domainlist) def update(self, req, id, body): """Add or modify domain entry.""" context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context) # NOTE(shaohe-feng): back-compatible with db layer hard-code # admin permission checks. nova_context.require_admin_context(context) fqdomain = _unquote_domain(id) try: entry = body['domain_entry'] scope = entry['scope'] except (TypeError, KeyError): raise webob.exc.HTTPUnprocessableEntity() project = entry.get('project', None) av_zone = entry.get('availability_zone', None) if (scope not in ('private', 'public') or project and av_zone or scope == 'private' and project or scope == 'public' and av_zone): raise webob.exc.HTTPUnprocessableEntity() if scope == 'private': create_dns_domain = self.network_api.create_private_dns_domain area_name, area = 'availability_zone', av_zone else: create_dns_domain = self.network_api.create_public_dns_domain area_name, area = 'project', project try: create_dns_domain(context, fqdomain, area) except NotImplementedError: msg = _("Unable to create dns domain") raise webob.exc.HTTPNotImplemented(explanation=msg) return _translate_domain_entry_view({'domain': fqdomain, 'scope': scope, area_name: area}) def delete(self, req, id): """Delete the domain identified by id.""" context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context) # NOTE(shaohe-feng): back-compatible with db layer hard-code # admin permission checks. nova_context.require_admin_context(context) domain = _unquote_domain(id) # Delete the whole domain try: self.network_api.delete_dns_domain(context, domain) except exception.NotFound as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=e.format_message()) except NotImplementedError: msg = _("Unable to delete dns domain") raise webob.exc.HTTPNotImplemented(explanation=msg) return webob.Response(status_int=202) class FloatingIPDNSEntryController(object): """DNS Entry controller for OpenStack API.""" def __init__(self): self.network_api = network.API() super(FloatingIPDNSEntryController, self).__init__() def show(self, req, domain_id, id): """Return the DNS entry that corresponds to domain_id and id.""" context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context) domain = _unquote_domain(domain_id) floating_ip = None # Check whether id is a valid ipv4/ipv6 address. if netutils.is_valid_ip(id): floating_ip = id try: if floating_ip: entries = self.network_api.get_dns_entries_by_address( context, floating_ip, domain) else: entries = self.network_api.get_dns_entries_by_name( context, id, domain) except NotImplementedError: msg = _("Unable to get dns entry") raise webob.exc.HTTPNotImplemented(explanation=msg) if not entries: explanation = _("DNS entries not found.") raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=explanation) if floating_ip: entrylist = [_create_dns_entry(floating_ip, entry, domain) for entry in entries] dns_entries = _translate_dns_entries_view(entrylist) return wsgi.ResponseObject(dns_entries) entry = _create_dns_entry(entries[0], id, domain) return _translate_dns_entry_view(entry) def update(self, req, domain_id, id, body): """Add or modify dns entry.""" context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context) domain = _unquote_domain(domain_id) name = id try: entry = body['dns_entry'] address = entry['ip'] dns_type = entry['dns_type'] except (TypeError, KeyError): raise webob.exc.HTTPUnprocessableEntity() try: entries = self.network_api.get_dns_entries_by_name( context, name, domain) if not entries: # create! self.network_api.add_dns_entry(context, address, name, dns_type, domain) else: # modify! self.network_api.modify_dns_entry(context, name, address, domain) except NotImplementedError: msg = _("Unable to create dns entry") raise webob.exc.HTTPNotImplemented(explanation=msg) return _translate_dns_entry_view({'ip': address, 'name': name, 'type': dns_type, 'domain': domain}) def delete(self, req, domain_id, id): """Delete the entry identified by req and id.""" context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context) domain = _unquote_domain(domain_id) name = id try: self.network_api.delete_dns_entry(context, name, domain) except exception.NotFound as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=e.format_message()) except NotImplementedError: msg = _("Unable to delete dns entry") raise webob.exc.HTTPNotImplemented(explanation=msg) return webob.Response(status_int=202) class Floating_ip_dns(extensions.ExtensionDescriptor): """Floating IP DNS support.""" name = "FloatingIpDns" alias = "os-floating-ip-dns" namespace = "http://docs.openstack.org/ext/floating_ip_dns/api/v1.1" updated = "2011-12-23T00:00:00Z" def __init__(self, ext_mgr): self.network_api = network.API() super(Floating_ip_dns, self).__init__(ext_mgr) def get_resources(self): resources = [] res = extensions.ResourceExtension('os-floating-ip-dns', FloatingIPDNSDomainController()) resources.append(res) res = extensions.ResourceExtension('entries', FloatingIPDNSEntryController(), parent={'member_name': 'domain', 'collection_name': 'os-floating-ip-dns'}) resources.append(res) return resources

commit_message:
Add an option to isntall a tempest plugin repo before running tempest

This commit adds a new config option which will install a plugin before
running tox to execute the tempest tests. This will enable plugin users
to run properly venv isolated tests even when using a plugin.

Change-Id: I0cc457ad9dc80f51929194ff3c64fbef286acdff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/46/297446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use provider net on OSIC

We can attach our instances directly to the new public provider net
rather than using floating IPs. Switch over to this as it will eliminate
the need for FIP managment which is leaky.

Change-Id: Ia3e01c18b22c01ac9fa9caa4885811ce58d7eb86

commit_message:
Remove cinder migrate constraint on in-use volume

The docs mistakenly state that an in-use volume cannot be migrated,
but this is no longer true.

Change-Id: I6196a18b82a0bdaf4a9d4eaf3063ccfe80319336
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/36/324636/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If the volume has snapshots, the specified host destination cannot accept the volume. If the user is not an administrator, the migration fails.
deleted_lines: If the volume is in use or has snapshots, the specified host destination cannot accept the volume. If the user is not an administrator, the migration fails.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary pot file for release notes

We are generating a pot file for release notes
at master branch only,
but openstack-manuals also has it at stable/mitaka branch.
It becomes an unnecessary translation resource at Zanata.

Change-Id: Ie34fac3f18914f379af2079aa489c6b5d9741b7b
Closes-Bug: #1587221

commit_message:
Create symlink for libvirt save directory

Nova can fill up the partition that /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save is on
when nova calls `image-create` on an instance. This occurs because nova
calls libvirt with managedsave which creates a temporary file in the
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save location. Libvirt does not allow the location
of /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save to be configurable so we have to manage it
ourselves via bindmounts or symlinks. In this commit we remove the
/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save directory and create a symlink in it's place,
pointing to `{{ nova_system_home_folder }}/save` instead (which we also
create). This location was chosen as deployers often have more space
here for nova instances.

Change-Id: Icaad091a00974148faf78edfbb5a6879903fe4ee
Partial-Bug: #1585325
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/324198/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if qemu save directory is a directory stat: path: "/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save" register: qemu_savedir_stat - name: Check if qemu save directory is empty shell: cmd: 'ls -1A /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save' register: qemu_savedir_empty # We force the link creation if our tests passed, this removes the directory as # well - name: Symlink qemu save dir to nova_libvirt_save_path file: path: "/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save" state: link owner: "{{ nova_qemu_user }}" group: "{{ nova_qemu_group }}" src: "{{ nova_libvirt_save_path }}" force: True when: - qemu_savedir_stat.stat.isdir - qemu_savedir_empty.stdout_lines | length == 0

commit_message:
[install] Update ec2authtoken version suffix

Updated ec2authtoken auth_uri in heat.conf with
v3 suffix.  This is required if one wants to utilize
autoscaling in heat.

Change-Id: I06a498bce261ed6929476d12d04d7eaaf6df96b0
Closes-Bug: 1588111

commit_message:
Apply a heuristic for product name if a user_agent is not provided

Apply a heuristic when the caller of keystoneauth Session does not
specify a user_agent. The approach is simple:
 - use the name of the calling program aka sys.argv[0]
 - if that name is in the ignore list, look at the call stack to
   determine who imported this module. Again, honoring a ignore list.
 - return None if all else fails

This ensures that all of the OpenStack services are logged properly in
Keystone's http access logs.

Change-Id: I942fbac97ad830639cf4c45f6e8fb253838f54e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/75/288175/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Global amqp and hacking requirements

Per bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1586840, the most
recent amqp version is not backward compatible, and breaks various
things along the oslo_messaging chain.  This manifests in
networking-powervm as an import failure for 'vine'.  This problem is
resolved by updating the amqp requirement to align with
global-requirements per If7e130a70f31a2eb1d9df6b5f46f88c90880e254.

The hacking checks for neutron also rely upon
hacking.core.off_by_default.  This is satisfied by the global
requirement for this package.

Change-Id: I7981e89710690cad3edbc8b953aac7cc07457f4e
Partial-Bug: 1586840

commit_message:
WIP: allow federated mappings that do not result in groups

a major benefit of storing federated users as shadow users is that
we will be able to directly assign roles to a single user. this
also means that the hard dependency on the mapping engine resulting
in a valid "group" is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I83537afbde65391a1493e5937b011d13f5ecccf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/93/291093/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: group_ids = mapped_properties['group_ids'] utils.validate_groups_cardinality(group_ids, mapping_id) utils.validate_groups_in_backend(group_ids, mapping_id, identity_api) group_ids.extend( utils.transform_to_group_ids( mapped_properties['group_names'], mapping_id, identity_api, resource_api)) mapped_properties['group_ids'] = list(set(group_ids))

commit_message:
Catch RetriableConnectionFailures from KAuth and retry

Some keystone auth failures are retriable, this patch ensures that when
ironiclient retries are turned on, we also retry on those failures.

Change-Id: I7181b2aa4c8d0cc3b5523cb913562bee2e1955a2
Closes-Bug: #1537076

added_lines: from keystoneauth1 import exceptions as kexc exc.ConnectionRefused, kexc.RetriableConnectionFailure)

commit_message:
New project: js-openstack-lib

This new project will be incubated as a single, gate-tested JavaScript
API client library for the OpenStack API’s. Its audience is software
engineers who wish to build their own user interface using modern
javascript tools. As we cannot predict downstream use cases, special
care will be taken to ensure the project’s release artifacts can
support both browser and server based applications.

Philosophically, we will be taking several pages from shade, and avoid
creating a new project for each of OpenStack's services; most plugins will
be kept in-tree. Furthermore, we'll be consuming the same clouds.yaml
configuration format documented by os-client-config.

Change-Id: Id7413a12ac08ea759e583f3ec2287684012e6d95
Needed-by: I35c68606da929d3a383119ae49985b2eaf9c6950

commit_message:
OS_INTERFACE ignored when determining endpoint_type

This fix simply looks for the OS_INTERFACE var before
trying to normalize the endpoint_type

Change-Id: Id2776ed149c60be023ff555b6c76b96579c3338a
Closes-bug: #1586434

No role for mounting the drives in swift object

ansible playbook. This patch closes the bug with necessary code
modifications.
Closes-bug: #1535536

Change-Id: I1572323ba516e0fa19a576f467845c7a462db1d5

commit_message:
Allow apache file overrides

This commit extends the config_template action plugin to allow apache
directrives to be overridden and/or added.

Note:

* The library used to parse apache configuration files is fairly new,
  but has a decent set of tests right now. Ideally the playbooks would
  perform a check to see if the apache config file that has been
  overridden is a valid apache file.

UpgradeImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia737a74e8c8f7a0b23b4359459a571ee91180b78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/98/275298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from parse_apache_configs import parse_config 'yaml': 'return_config_overrides_yaml', 'apache': 'return_config_overrdies_apache' def return_config_overrides_apache(self, config_overrides, resultant): """Returns string value from a modified apache config file. :param config_overrides: ``dict`` :param resultant: ``str`` || ``unicode`` :returns: ``str`` """ _resultant = str(resultant) apache_config_obj = parse_config.ParseApacheConfig( apache_file_as_string=_resultant ) conf_list = apache_conf_obj.parse_config() for directive_path in config_overrides: directive_name = directive_path[-1].split()[0] directive_arguments = " ".join(directive_path[-1].split()[1:]).strip() if len(directive_path) > 1: path = directive_path[:-1] else: path = [] conf_list = apache_conf_obj.add_directive( conf_list, directive_name, directive_arguments, *path ) return apache_conf_obj.get_apache_config(conf_list) It's important to note that file ordering will not be preserved as the assert config_type.lower() in ['ini', 'json', 'yaml', 'apache']
deleted_lines: 'yaml': 'return_config_overrides_yaml' Its important to note that file ordering will not be preserved as the assert config_type.lower() in ['ini', 'json', 'yaml']

commit_message:
Revert workaround disabling Keystone cache

An issue was discovered with an upstream change [1] which caused frequent yet
inconsistent issues in the OpenStack-Ansible gate. As a workaround the added
Keystone cache was entirely disabled as the most-consistent fix. This change
simply reverts that workaround.

Because the change this reverts was labeled with an upgrade impace, that tag
is also applied to this change to ensure proper record keeping can be done.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/215212/

UpgradeImpact
Change-Id: I27bac1b72f6fdb2335752f8cf835be086bed3819
Reverts-Id: I3b2a833a3e96a3b5deac76052eed480ddcb6175d
Depends-On: Id6ee76f896fe738b4c4de432eb57cc0437ffdb6b
Depends-On: Ic5134a5974af2431901613e6de918c2547ca9cf6
Related-Bug: #1537617

commit_message:
Allow only vxlan networks to be defined.

This fix adds a conditional around the L3HA
directives in the neutron.conf.j2 template.
The conditional checks to make sure
neutron_provider_networks.network_mappings_list
isn't empty.

Change-Id: Ia6f74bdddfb16b296625db9500e24edfc133d141
Closes-Bug: #1528307

commit_message:
Rename nova variables in spice section

This will make it understand clearly

- Rename nova spice variables name "nova_console_agent_enabled" to
  "nova_spice_console_agent_enabled" and "nova_console_agent_enabled"
  to "nova_spice_console_keymap".

- Remove "nova_console_agent_enabled" and "nova_console_keymap" variables
  which is defined in defaults/nova.yml.

Change-Id: Ib0a4d8b1141cda11ab584778fffbe088aeee1f1a

commit_message:
Release TripleO 5.0.0.0b1

This is a first TripleO release in Newton cycle.

* Create yaml files for each project we release.
* Put the yaml files in newton directory, since we now follow
  release pace and use trailing model.
* Switch to a consistent release tag:
    - 5 (newton)
    - 6 (ocata)
    - 7 (p) ...

Note: instack-undercloud and instack are missing because no release job
specified in zuul layout. A patch will follow soon to release them.

Change-Id: I58cb2060cd1dca789342fb38ba6a91dd51dce07c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 21:25:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vios.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vios.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/exception.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/0b2125e64c628c90633b08dbe4033bcbb5fafe92', 'message': "Raise an exception if no active VIOSes in build_tx_feed_task

get_active_vioses returns an empty list if there aren't any
active VIOSes. If an empty list is used as the feed to a FeedTask
then we get a generic error explaining that the FeedTask can't have
an empty feed.

This change attempts to make the error more clear in the event
there aren't any active VIOSes when build_tx_feed_task is called
by raising an exception explaining that there aren't any active

Closes-Bug: #1581652
"}]
commit_message:
Raise an exception if no active VIOSes in build_tx_feed_task

get_active_vioses returns an empty list if there aren't any
active VIOSes. If an empty list is used as the feed to a FeedTask
then we get a generic error explaining that the FeedTask can't have
an empty feed.

This change attempts to make the error more clear in the event
there aren't any active VIOSes when build_tx_feed_task is called
by raising an exception explaining that there aren't any active
VIOSes.

Change-Id: I3d67c653131952bfc13bbbda2e67486c0291c4cc
Closes-Bug: #1581652

commit_message:
Fix keystone error handling in openstack driver

Keystone exceptions are not thrown during client initialization. User
credentials are only validated when keystone client apis such as
regions, services and endpoints are queried using the client object.

Change-Id: I0bda03353e054c0f00a704a4619eceb670e1a7f7
Closes-Bug: #1567123
(cherry picked from commit 92c891b83586fbe40787b02c97a6ba69238d4728)

commit_message:
Add maxsize param for work queues in executors

Currently we do not have any size limit of work queues in ThreadPoolExecutor
and GreenThreadPoolExecutor. Tasks can be submitted without any restrictions
although workers may not be enough to proccess them timely and it fact can leads
to potential memory leaks.

So, limitation a size of work queue is very helpful in many cases then we
want that a task producer must be blocked until at least one worker in a pool
is be available for executing.

Change-Id: Id3378cf84d60b04c930840211b42485b8890bc51

subject: Avoid starting serial console workers while deleting vm files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 16:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/vmops.py', 'hyperv/nova/serialconsoleops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_serialconsoleops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_vmops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv/commit/47c9525814e89ac92b12f93bd54d240c79a5056a', 'message': 'Avoid starting serial console workers while deleting vm files

If an instance destroy request is received really quick after it was
powered on, this can fail, having the console log files in use.

This can happen if the instance power on event is received after the
destroy operation has started, which will spawn serial console workers
after the destroy operation tries to clean them up.

We can avoid this situation by simply ensuring that while we delete
the instance log files, the serial console workers are stopped and
no other workers will be spawned.

Change-Id: I3759b557d735cde4391f94819a32994dfb184702
Closes-Bug: #1556189
(cherry picked from commit 1c16530da82571cca666d30942b11d558a92162d)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid starting serial console workers while deleting vm files

If an instance destroy request is received really quick after it was
powered on, this can fail, having the console log files in use.

This can happen if the instance power on event is received after the
destroy operation has started, which will spawn serial console workers
after the destroy operation tries to clean them up.

We can avoid this situation by simply ensuring that while we delete
the instance log files, the serial console workers are stopped and
no other workers will be spawned.

Change-Id: I3759b557d735cde4391f94819a32994dfb184702
Closes-Bug: #1556189
(cherry picked from commit 1c16530da82571cca666d30942b11d558a92162d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/76/320576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add content-disposition header to tempurl request

Added content-disposition header to HEAD tempurl request.
As per HTTP docs[1] HEAD response must be identical to GET
except return message-body response.

[1]https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-9.4

Change-Id: Ie60a6fb632613055da5279db5b128ce5ee5172ae
Closes-Bug:#1539805

commit_message:
Fix untranslated strings and adding icon to OK button

In ng-container, titles in Create Folder modal and Upload Object
modal are untranslated.
And OK button in these modal are missing icon (in Create
Container modal, OK button has a icon).

Change-Id: I7b18ceb6d3aafd5b183eb730970c0be792df9f2b
Closes-Bug: #1586286

commit_message:
Raise fixtures requirement to 3.0.0

Fixtures 1.4 has a bug with MonkeyPatch and its handling of
staticmethods for python3. Essentially a monkey patched static method is
no longer a static method after the fixture cleans up.

This was fixed in fixtures 2.0 but unfortunately that release
inadvertently added further constraints on the use of MonkeyPatch that
caused a number of legitimate uses to error. So fixtures was capped to
1.4.

Fixtures 3.0 fixes the bug from 1.4 but does not cause failures with
current legitimate uses of MonkeyPatch. This has been confirmed against
py27 and py24 unit tests on Nova and Neutron, and functional tests on
Nova.

Change-Id: I214583f7c27fcfe3f6b17700710ef27c8ecdbbab
Depends-On: I9c5635d0930b091e1ae0a1439d687dd20a0ff939
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/76/323576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

In order to use the 3.0.0 release of the fixtures library some tests
needed to be updated in order to be compatible with 1.4 and 3.0.

Most failures with 3.0 were due to using bound methods of a class to
patch another class. This requires a different signature on the method
used for patching between the fixtures versions. Moving the methods to
be functions addresses this for the cases where the test method does not
need to access the class it was defined on.

For test_networks a different tact was needed. Because the methods used
for patching require accessing state on their defined class a proxy
method is introduced. This proxy method captures and discards the 'self'
parameter from the call point of the patched method. By doing so the
patching methods can have the same signature for multiple fixtures
versions.

Change-Id: I9c5635d0930b091e1ae0a1439d687dd20a0ff939
"}]
commit_message:
Update functional tests for fixtures 3

In order to use the 3.0.0 release of the fixtures library some tests
needed to be updated in order to be compatible with 1.4 and 3.0.

Most failures with 3.0 were due to using bound methods of a class to
patch another class. This requires a different signature on the method
used for patching between the fixtures versions. Moving the methods to
be functions addresses this for the cases where the test method does not
need to access the class it was defined on.

For test_networks a different tact was needed. Because the methods used
for patching require accessing state on their defined class a proxy
method is introduced. This proxy method captures and discards the 'self'
parameter from the call point of the patched method. By doing so the
patching methods can have the same signature for multiple fixtures
versions.

Change-Id: I9c5635d0930b091e1ae0a1439d687dd20a0ff939
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/323573/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _fixtures_passthrough(method_name): # This compensates for how fixtures 3.x handles the signatures of # MonkeyPatched functions vs fixtures < 3.x. In fixtures 3 if a bound # method is patched in for a bound method then both objects will be passed # in when called. This means the patch method should have the signature of # (self, targetself, *args, **kwargs). However that will not work for # fixtures < 3. This method captures self from the call point and discards # it since it's not needed. fake_network_api = test_networks.FakeNetworkAPI() method = getattr(fake_network_api, method_name) def call(self, *args, **kwargs): # self is the nova.network.api.API object that has been patched # method is bound to FakeNetworkAPI so that will be passed in as self return method(*args, **kwargs) return call self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.get_all", _fixtures_passthrough('get_all')) self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.get", _fixtures_passthrough('get')) _fixtures_passthrough('associate')) self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.delete", _fixtures_passthrough('delete')) self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.create", _fixtures_passthrough('create')) _fixtures_passthrough('add_network_to_project'))
deleted_lines: fake_network_api = test_networks.FakeNetworkAPI() self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.get_all", fake_network_api.get_all) self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.get", fake_network_api.get) fake_network_api.associate) self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.delete", fake_network_api.delete) self.stub_out("nova.network.api.API.create", fake_network_api.create) fake_network_api.add_network_to_project)

subject: Fix volume backup import test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-13 12:08:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f718b2d657d8e6a745c3ed94771a24b419b500e4', 'message': 'Fix volume backup import test

There is a bug in Cinder (#1455043) and backups are incorrectly imported
into the DB, and once that is fixed current tempest backup import/export
test will fail.

The reason for mentioned failure is that backup imports preserve
original backup id, so we cannot import a backup to a system where it
already exists, as is the case of our test.

This patch fixes this by importing the backup with a "fake" uuid so that
the import doesn't give an error.

This test would fail for incremental backups (which we are not using in
the test) and back-ends that require the ID to be preserved (which are
already skipping this test), so there's no problem.

Related-Bug: #1455043
Related-Bug: #1476416
Depends-On: Ia42ba73e9078d993c63f8e16308151ad11721ea9
Change-Id: I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5

commit_message:
Fix volume backup import test

There is a bug in Cinder (#1455043) and backups are incorrectly imported
into the DB, and once that is fixed current tempest backup import/export
test will fail.

The reason for mentioned failure is that backup imports preserve
original backup id, so we cannot import a backup to a system where it
already exists, as is the case of our test.

This patch fixes this by importing the backup with a "fake" uuid so that
the import doesn't give an error.

Co-Authored-By: Yuriy Nesenenko <ynesenenko@mirantis.com>
Related-Bug: #1476416
Change-Id: I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/01/212501/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import base64import six def _decode_url(self, backup_url): return json.loads(base64.decodestring(backup_url)) def _encode_backup(self, backup): retval = json.dumps(backup) if six.PY3: retval = retval.encode('utf-8') return base64.encodestring(retval) def modify_backup_url(self, backup_url, changes): backup = self._decode_url(backup_url) backup.update(changes) return self._encode_backup(backup)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 16:50:16.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_migrationops.py', 'hyperv/nova/migrationops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv/commit/7527a1f4d60a804f54cba7a7da706bf66863d789', 'message': 'hyper-v: Copies back files on failed migration

Because of this, when the migration fails to copy the files, it will
try to revert this through folder renaming. Since the original folder

Change-Id: Ia42ed873924999d57336a105bcaa2b856f3a3a9d

(cherry picked from commit 7fb627c317d93b041b76263740f5729dade05b39)

commit_message:
hyper-v: Copies back files on failed migration

On cold migration, the contents of the instance folder are
copied to the new host. The original folder cannot be removed
because the VM configuration files cannot be deleted until the VM
is destroyed.

Because of this, when the migration fails to copy the files, it will
try to revert this through folder renaming. Since the original folder
still exists, an exception is raised.

Change-Id: Ia42ed873924999d57336a105bcaa2b856f3a3a9d
Closes-Bug: #1555699
(cherry picked from commit 7fb627c317d93b041b76263740f5729dade05b39)

commit_message:
OVN NB sync may delete all ACLs for a port

OVN NB sync may delete all ACLs for a port when it should only delete
specific ACLs. This problem impacts both service startup and the
neutron-ovn-db-sync command-line utility.

Change-Id: Ia9cf6f94416a5c73439cb61c63f62b714c1d776a
Closes-Bug: #1586163

commit_message:
Print installed tempest-plugins after tempest run

The ALL_PLUGINS tox job runs tempest in a venv with system site-packages
enabled. This can make it very confusing to figure out exactly which
plugins are installed when tempest is run. Especially given many
projects' terrible choice to bundle the plugin in the project repo.
This commit adds running 'tempest list-plugins' inside the venv tox
makes for that job to show at the end of a run all the plugins tempest
was run with.

Change-Id: I8a65c851cdf5a4081ac32afa17f69ee001ff40c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/65/319465/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo -H -u tempest .tox/all-plugin/bin/tempest list-plugins

commit_message:
Make use of arbitrary playbook usage in images CI script

We now have the ability to use an arbitrary playbook via
quickstart.sh. So, instead of calling ansible-playbook
directly in the images CI script we should use that new
capability. This allows for having consistent reproducer
instructions for all of the tripleo-quickstart jobs in RDO CI.

Change-Id: I3ed699437dc4009b46040f91240ac118f714f1cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/67/324567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # These are set here to make it possible to locally reproduce the promote # image building job in the same way as the other jobs. PUBLISH=${PUBLISH:-"false"} delorean_current_hash=${delorean_current_hash:-"consistent"} if [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "gate" ] || [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "periodic" ]; then PLAYBOOK='build-images-and-quickstart.yml' delorean_current_hash='current-passed-ci' elif [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "promote" ]; then PLAYBOOK='build-images.yml' else echo "Job type must be one of gate, periodic, or promote" exit 1 fibash $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/quickstart.sh \ --tags all \ --config $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/config/general_config/$CONFIG.yml \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --playbook $PLAYBOOK \ --extra-vars image_url="file:///var/lib/oooq-images/undercloud.qcow2" \ --extra-vars artib_release=$RELEASE \ --extra-vars artib_build_system=$BUILD_SYS \ --extra-vars artib_delorean_hash=$delorean_current_hash \ --extra-vars publish=$PUBLISH \ --no-clone \ $VIRTHOST $RELEASE
deleted_lines: anscmd="stdbuf -oL -eL ansible-playbook -vv" pushd $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart# (trown) I don't totally understand why this is needed here, but activating # the venv is failing otherwise. export VIRTUAL_ENV_DISABLE_PROMPT=1 source $WORKSPACE/bin/activate if [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "gate" ] || [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "periodic" ]; then $anscmd -i local_hosts \ $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/playbooks/build-images-and-quickstart.yml \ --extra-vars ansible_python_interpreter=/usr/bin/python \ --extra-vars virthost=$VIRTHOST \ --extra-vars local_working_dir=$WORKSPACE/ \ --extra-vars image_url="file:///var/lib/oooq-images/undercloud.qcow2" \ --extra-vars artib_release=$RELEASE \ --extra-vars artib_build_system=$BUILD_SYS \ --extra-vars @$WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/config/general_config/$CONFIG.yml elif [ "$JOB_TYPE" = "promote" ]; then $anscmd -i local_hosts \ $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/playbooks/build-images.yml \ --extra-vars ansible_python_interpreter=/usr/bin/python \ --extra-vars virthost=$VIRTHOST \ --extra-vars local_working_dir=$WORKSPACE/ \ --extra-vars artib_release=$RELEASE \ --extra-vars release=$RELEASE \ --extra-vars artib_build_system=$BUILD_SYS \ --extra-vars build_system=$BUILD_SYS \ --extra-vars artib_delorean_hash=$delorean_current_hash \ --extra-vars publish=true else echo "Job type must be one of gate, periodic, or promote" exit 1 fi

commit_message:
Switch to libguestfs for CentOS

In an effort to save HDD space, we can use libguestfs to mount our
qcow2 images.

Change-Id: I8f838c97741a3f851731ac3b210db6adb2ccf395
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/60/323560/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: yum install -y libguestfs-tools guestmount --rw -a $IMAGE -i $MOUNTDIR guestunmount $MOUNTDIR
deleted_lines: # NOTE(pabelanger): Sadly, nbd module is missing from CentOS 7, # so we need to convert the image to raw format. A fix for this # would be support raw instack images in our nightly builds. qemu-img convert -f qcow2 -O raw ${IMAGE} ${IMAGE/qcow2/raw} rm -rf ${IMAGE} sudo kpartx -avs ${IMAGE/qcow2/raw} # The qcow2 images may be a whole disk or single partition sudo mount /dev/mapper/loop0p1 $MOUNTDIR || sudo mount /dev/loop0 $MOUNTDIR sudo kpartx -dv ${IMAGE/qcow2/raw} qemu-img convert -f raw -O qcow2 ${IMAGE/qcow2/raw} ${IMAGE} rm -rf ${IMAGE/qcow2/raw}

commit_message:
Fix keystone error handling in openstack driver

Keystone exceptions are not thrown during client initialization. User
credentials are only validated when keystone client apis such as
regions, services and endpoints are queried using the client object.

Change-Id: I0bda03353e054c0f00a704a4619eceb670e1a7f7
Closes-Bug: #1567123
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/06/321806/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneclient import exceptionsfrom tacker.extensions import nfvo def test_register_vim_invalid_credentials(self): attrs = {'regions.list.side_effect': exceptions.Unauthorized} keystone_version = 'v3' mock_ks_client = mock.Mock(version=keystone_version, **attrs) self.keystone.get_version.return_value = keystone_version self.keystone.initialize_client.return_value = mock_ks_client self.assertRaises(nfvo.VimUnauthorizedException, self.openstack_driver.register_vim, self.vim_obj) mock_ks_client.regions.list.assert_called_once_with() self.keystone.initialize_client.assert_called_once_with( version=keystone_version, **self.auth_obj)

commit_message:
Create private share types

Properly propagate the value of "Public" checkbox to manilaclient when
creating a new share type otherwise all share types are created with
public visibility.

Change-Id: I09d09e48045f515ab335773c52074d9ce8344288
Closes-bug: #1584430

commit_message:
Make Aggregate.get operation favor the API db

This makes the Aggregate object use the API database first only falling
back to the cell database if it is not available.

blueprint cells-aggregate-api-db

Change-Id: Id3616cef1937744bf600763bae5de50f1d27b783
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/296014/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy.orm import joinedload from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api as db_api from nova.db.sqlalchemy import api_modelsDEPRECATED_FIELDS = ['deleted', 'deleted_at'] @db_api.api_context_manager.reader def _aggregate_get_from_db(context, aggregate_id): query = context.session.query(api_models.Aggregate).\ options(joinedload('_hosts')).\ options(joinedload('_metadata')) query = query.filter(api_models.Aggregate.id == aggregate_id) aggregate = query.first() if not aggregate: raise exception.AggregateNotFound(aggregate_id=aggregate_id) return aggregate @staticmethod elif key in DEPRECATED_FIELDS and key not in db_aggregate: continue # NOTE: This can be removed when we remove compatibility with # the old aggregate model. if any(f not in db_aggregate for f in DEPRECATED_FIELDS): aggregate.deleted_at = None aggregate.deleted = False try: db_aggregate = cls._aggregate_get_from_db(context, aggregate_id) except exception.AggregateNotFound: db_aggregate = db.aggregate_get(context, aggregate_id)

commit_message:
Support for snapshot force delete

Cinder snapshot force delete is supported from cinder server
side but cinderclient support is not present.

This patchset adds support for cinder snapshot force delete
from cinderclient side.

Closes-Bug:#1418353

Change-Id: I8c4f02f9c3b855d44b1a3c7da7083d87b3b70da9
Implements: Blueprint snapshot-backup-force-delete
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/25/313925/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete(self, force=False): return self.manager.delete(self, force) def delete(self, snapshot, force=False): :param force: The :class:`Snapshot` to delete forcefully. if force: return self._action('os-force_delete', snapshot) else: return self._delete("/snapshots/%s" % base.getid(snapshot))
deleted_lines: def delete(self): return self.manager.delete(self) def delete(self, snapshot): return self._delete("/snapshots/%s" % base.getid(snapshot))

commit_message:
SMBFS: properly handle empty connection info options

We use regex to fetch the crentials from the connection info options
when mounting SMB shares.

The issue is that this field may be empty, in which case we may get
a TypeError. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I44f8a74ad38e4419f58bf8f59682af79fff8070c
Closes-Bug: #1564829
(cherry picked from commit 01eec24a13d2886440d2ea71eb84d9598b09380c)

added_lines: opts_str = connection_info['data'].get('options') or ''

commit_message:
Create specs directory for Ocata

The deadline for non-priority specs for Newton is almost here,
and as always there will be a large number of specs that do
not get approved. Any that remain in the Newton directory will
eventually get force abandoned. Opening up the Ocata directory
allows submitters who wish to re-target their effort to the
subsequent release, to move their spec across to the new
directory straight away enabling ongoing visibility & review.

Change-Id: I732576bb3c0e60ec130cdf73647fbc2f234905f7
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

subject: DVR: Fix check multiprefix when delete ipv4 router interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 00:03:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/80caa5773f74abef4a24b9f9c44eaf24fcf62723', 'message': "DVR: Fix check multiprefix when delete ipv4 router interface

Current code will prevent from deleting router centralized snat port,
when there is a ipv6 subnet attatched to DVR.

This is correct when deleting a v6 router centralized snat port, because
multiple v6 subnets share one router port.

But it is not correct when deleteing a v4 router centralized snat port,
because v4 subnet doesn't share router port with v6 subnet. Deleteing a
v4 router centralized snat port should be allowed no matter if there is
v6 subnet attached to DVR.

Change-Id: I2d06c8c79f9ff9a9300a94bcbbae13569e4d963e
Closes-bug: #1581348

commit_message:
DVR: Fix check multiprefix when delete ipv4 router interface

Current code will prevent from deleting router centralized snat port,
when there is a ipv6 subnet attatched to DVR.

This is correct when deleting a v6 router centralized snat port, because
multiple v6 subnets share one router port.

But it is not correct when deleteing a v4 router centralized snat port,
because v4 subnet doesn't share router port with v6 subnet. Deleteing a
v4 router centralized snat port should be allowed no matter if there is
v6 subnet attached to DVR.

Change-Id: I2d06c8c79f9ff9a9300a94bcbbae13569e4d963e
Closes-bug: #1581348
(cherry picked from commit 084173338e5e21ff37f042f69718237b94843665)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/39/324139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if len(fixed_ips) == len(cs_port['port']['fixed_ips']): # The subnet being detached from router is not part of # ipv6 router port. No need to update the multiprefix. return False

commit_message:
Use ubuntu-minimal instead of ubuntu-core

Support of ubuntu-core was dropped and now it is impossible to
continue using it. Therefore, start using ubuntu-minimal OS element
for building image.

Also, add 'other-requirements.txt' file with list of required system
packages to be installed prior to buidling image.

Change-Id: Ief7059b9e6cc2aad03c81225663f5313a8d2f5f2
Closes-Bug: #1586351

commit_message:
Redundant test of CPU resources in test_tracker

There was a test in test_resource_tracker.py that was doing nothing more
than ensuring the vcpus_used value was properly set after an instance
claim. This code path is already tested multiple times in
test_tracker.py's TestInstanceClaim methods.

Change-Id: I5bcc4fe60dc777c7fbe739b6030d9e897e8ecdef

Remove duplicate test of claim context manager

Removes a unit test -- test_context_claim_from_exception -- from
test_resource_tracker.py that was entirely duplicated by
TestInstanceClaim.test_claim_abort_context_manager() in test_tracker.py.

commit_message:
Remove pointless "additive claims" unit test

There was a test in test_resource_tracker.py that was, no joke,
repeating an instance claim of the same flavor and checking that the
amount used from a previously-empty node was 2 times the resource
amounts associated with the flavor. This is a useless test and doesn't
exercise any more code paths that existing unit tests in
test_tracker.TestInstanceClaim already stress.

Change-Id: I4b8d4c701ad7db1469a55835067377a58c12884c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/322523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove oversubscribe test in test_resource_tracker

Oversubscription -- i.e. taking the xxx_allocation_ratio fields into
account when calculating whether a compute node can host an instance --
is something that is handled in the scheduler. There was a unit test in
test_resource_tracker.py that was trying to test something about
oversubscription but was actually doing nothing more than testing the
same code paths that unit tests in test_tracker.TestInstanceClaim are
already doing: that the math of consuming or freeing the claimed amount
of requested resources was correct. So, let's remove this duplicate and
misleading unit test.

Change-Id: If462b150c24411fc7cc7a677fbe3467e95f8d081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/322522/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_instance_claim_with_oversubscription(self, mock_get): memory_mb = FAKE_VIRT_MEMORY_MB * 2 root_gb = ephemeral_gb = FAKE_VIRT_LOCAL_GB vcpus = FAKE_VIRT_VCPUS * 2 claim_topology = self._claim_topology(3) instance_topology = self._instance_topology(3) limits = {'memory_mb': memory_mb + FAKE_VIRT_MEMORY_OVERHEAD, 'disk_gb': root_gb * 2, 'vcpu': vcpus, 'numa_topology': FAKE_VIRT_NUMA_TOPOLOGY_OVERHEAD} instance = self._fake_instance_obj(memory_mb=memory_mb, root_gb=root_gb, ephemeral_gb=ephemeral_gb, numa_topology=instance_topology) with mock.patch.object(instance, 'save'): self.tracker.instance_claim(self.context, instance, limits) self.assertEqual(memory_mb + FAKE_VIRT_MEMORY_OVERHEAD, self.tracker.compute_node.memory_mb_used) self.assertEqualNUMAHostTopology( claim_topology, objects.NUMATopology.obj_from_db_obj( self.compute['numa_topology'])) self.assertEqual(root_gb * 2, self.tracker.compute_node.local_gb_used) @mock.patch('nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance_uuid', return_value=objects.InstancePCIRequests(requests=[]))

subject: Cap amqp requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-01 15:15:53.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/7b5e8a7f099a0a487b31b068331971c2313ce571', 'message': "Cap amqp requirement

Per bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1586840, the most
recent amqp version is not backward compatible, and breaks various
things along the oslo_messaging chain.  This manifests in nova-powervm
as an import failure for 'vine'.

This problem is resolved by updating the amqp requirement to align with
global-requirements per If7e130a70f31a2eb1d9df6b5f46f88c90880e254.

Change-Id: I022da2aefc222da863cf7f4e07c1adcd2c63f41d
Partial-Bug: 1586840

commit_message:
Cap amqp requirement

Per bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1586840, the most
recent amqp version is not backward compatible, and breaks various
things along the oslo_messaging chain.  This manifests in nova-powervm
as an import failure for 'vine'.

This problem is resolved by updating the amqp requirement to align with
global-requirements per If7e130a70f31a2eb1d9df6b5f46f88c90880e254.

Change-Id: I022da2aefc222da863cf7f4e07c1adcd2c63f41d
Partial-Bug: 1586840

Change-Id: I9020560d960274752d71de51e81d01cbcb0e4b31

commit_message:
Credential Encryption

Eliminate the implication that credential encryption does encryption as
part of db_sync

Change-Id: I9020560d960274752d71de51e81d01cbcb0e4b31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/14/324714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Document upgrade process and how to enable encryption. * Write keystone-manage command to encrypt existing credentials. If deployer has not specified encryption keys, migration will not re-encrypt the credentials.
deleted_lines: * Document Credential driver configuration changes. * Write Keystone database migration for existing credentials. If deployer has not specified encryption keys, migration will not re-encrypt the credentials.
